trans-unit.source: That a selection key indicates that its channel is ready for some operation is a hint, but not a guarantee, that such an operation can be performed by a thread without causing the thread to block. It is imperative that code that performs multiplexed I/O be written so as to ignore these hints when they prove to be incorrect.
trans-unit.target: El hecho de que una tecla de selección indique que su canal está listo para alguna operación es un indicio,pero no una garantía,de que dicha operación pueda ser realizada por un hilo sin que éste se bloquee.Es imperativo que el código que realiza la E/S multiplexada sea escrito de manera que se ignoren estas pistas cuando resulten ser incorrectas.

trans-unit.source: That a selection key's ready set indicates that its channel is ready for some operation category is a hint, but not a guarantee, that an operation in such a category may be performed by a thread without causing the thread to block. A ready set is most likely to be accurate immediately after the completion of a selection operation. It is likely to be made inaccurate by external events and by I/O operations that are invoked upon the corresponding channel.
trans-unit.target: El hecho de que el conjunto de teclas de selección indique que su canal está listo para alguna categoría de operación es una pista,pero no una garantía,de que una operación en esa categoría pueda ser realizada por un hilo sin que el hilo se bloquee.Es muy probable que un ready set sea exacto inmediatamente después de la finalización de una operación de selección.Es probable que se vuelva inexacto por eventos externos y por operaciones de E/S que se invocan en el canal correspondiente.

That supports three categories of application that modify entity resolution. Old Style applications won't know about this interface; they will provide an EntityResolver. Transitional Mode provide an EntityResolver2 and automatically get the benefit of its methods in any systems (parsers or other tools) supporting it, due to polymorphism. Both Old Style and Transitional Mode applications will work with any SAX2 parser. New style applications will fail to run except on SAX2 parsers that support this particular feature. They will insist that feature flag have a value of "true", and the EntityResolver2 implementation they provide might throw an exception if the original SAX 1.0 style entity resolution method is invoked.

The "Concurrent" prefix used with some classes in this package is a shorthand indicating several differences from similar "synchronized" classes. For example java.util.Hashtable and Collections.synchronizedMap(new HashMap()) are synchronized. But ConcurrentHashMap is "concurrent". A concurrent collection is thread-safe, but not governed by a single exclusion lock. In the particular case of ConcurrentHashMap, it safely permits any number of concurrent reads as well as a large number of concurrent writes. "Synchronized" classes can be useful when you need to prevent all access to a collection via a single lock, at the expense of poorer scalability. In other cases in which multiple threads are expected to access a common collection, "concurrent" versions are normally preferable. And unsynchronized collections are preferable when either collections are unshared, or are accessible only when holding other locks.

The "Concurrent" prefix used with some classes in this package is a shorthand indicating several differences from similar "synchronized" classes. For example java.util.Hashtable and Collections.synchronizedMap(new HashMap()) are synchronized. But ConcurrentHashMap is "concurrent". A concurrent collection is thread-safe, but not governed by a single exclusion lock. In the particular case of ConcurrentHashMap, it safely permits any number of concurrent reads as well as a tunable number of concurrent writes. "Synchronized" classes can be useful when you need to prevent all access to a collection via a single lock, at the expense of poorer scalability. In other cases in which multiple threads are expected to access a common collection, "concurrent" versions are normally preferable. And unsynchronized collections are preferable when either collections are unshared, or are accessible only when holding other locks.
trans-unit.target: El prefijo "Concurrente" usado con algunas clases en este paquete es una forma abreviada que indica varias diferencias con respecto a clases "sincronizadas" similares. Por ejemplo, java.util.Hashtable y Collections.synchronizedMap(new HashMap()) están sincronizados. Pero ConcurrentHashMap es "concurrente". Una colección simultánea es segura para subprocesos, pero no se rige por un solo bloqueo de exclusión. En el caso particular de ConcurrentHashMap, permite de forma segura cualquier número de lecturas simultáneas, así como un número ajustable de escrituras simultáneas. Las clases "sincronizadas" pueden ser útiles cuando necesita evitar todo acceso a una colección a través de un solo bloqueo, a expensas de una escalabilidad más pobre. En otros casos en los que se espera que varios subprocesos accedan a una colección común, normalmente se prefieren las versiones "simultáneas". Y las colecciones no sincronizadas son preferibles cuando las colecciones no están compartidas o son accesibles solo cuando se mantienen otros bloqueos.

The "contentPane" is the primary container for application specific components. Applications should add children to the contentPane, set its layout manager, and so on.

The "destructive" algorithms contained in this class, that is, the algorithms that modify the collection on which they operate, are specified to throw UnsupportedOperationException if the collection does not support the appropriate mutation primitive(s), such as the set method. These algorithms may, but are not required to, throw this exception if an invocation would have no effect on the collection. For example, invoking the sort method on an unmodifiable list that is already sorted may or may not throw UnsupportedOperationException.
trans-unit.target: Los algoritmos "destructivos" contenidos en esta clase, es decir, los algoritmos que modifican la colección en la que operan, se especifican para lanzar UnsupportedOperationException si la colección no admite las primitivas de mutación adecuadas, como el método set . Estos algoritmos pueden, pero no están obligados a hacerlo, lanzar esta excepción si una invocación no tendría ningún efecto en la colección. Por ejemplo, invocar el método sort en una lista no modificable que ya está ordenada puede o no generar UnsupportedOperationException .

trans-unit.source: The "destructive" methods contained in this interface, that is, the methods that modify the collection on which they operate, are specified to throw UnsupportedOperationException if this collection does not support the operation. If this is the case, these methods may, but are not required to, throw an UnsupportedOperationException if the invocation would have no effect on the collection. For example, invoking the addAll(Collection) method on an unmodifiable collection may, but is not required to, throw the exception if the collection to be added is empty.
trans-unit.target: Los métodos "destructivos" contenidos en esta interfaz, es decir, los métodos que modifican la colección en la que operan, se especifican para lanzar UnsupportedOperationException si esta colección no admite la operación. Si este es el caso, estos métodos pueden, pero no es obligatorio, lanzar una UnsupportedOperationException si la invocación no tendría ningún efecto en la colección. Por ejemplo, invocar el método addAll(Collection) en una colección no modificable puede, pero no es obligatorio, generar la excepción si la colección que se va a agregar está vacía.

trans-unit.source: The "destructive" methods contained in this interface, that is, the methods that modify the map on which they operate, are specified to throw UnsupportedOperationException if this map does not support the operation. If this is the case, these methods may, but are not required to, throw an UnsupportedOperationException if the invocation would have no effect on the map. For example, invoking the putAll(Map) method on an unmodifiable map may, but is not required to, throw the exception if the map whose mappings are to be "superimposed" is empty.

The "destructive" methods contained in this interface, that is, the methods that modify the map on which they operate, are specified to throw UnsupportedOperationException if this map does not support the operation. If this is the case, these methods may, but are not required to, throw an UnsupportedOperationException if the invocation would have no effect on the map. For example, invoking the putAll(Map) method on an unmodifiable map may, but is not required to, throw the exception if the map whose mappings are to be "superimposed" is empty.
trans-unit.target: Los métodos "destructivos" contenidos en esta interfaz, es decir, los métodos que modifican el mapa en el que operan, se especifican para lanzar UnsupportedOperationException si este mapa no admite la operación. Si este es el caso, estos métodos pueden, pero no es obligatorio, lanzar una UnsupportedOperationException si la invocación no tendría ningún efecto en el mapa. Por ejemplo, la invocación del putAll(Map) en un mapa no modificable puede, pero no es obligatorio, generar la excepción si el mapa cuyas asignaciones se van a "superponer" está vacío.

trans-unit.source: The "global" Logger object is provided as a convenience to developers who are making casual use of the Logging package. Developers who are making serious use of the logging package (for example in products) should create and use their own Logger objects, with appropriate names, so that logging can be controlled on a suitable per-Logger granularity. Developers also need to keep a strong reference to their Logger objects to prevent them from being garbage collected.
trans-unit.target: El objeto "global" Logger se proporciona como una conveniencia para los desarrolladores que hacen un uso casual del paquete Logging.Los desarrolladores que hacen un uso serio del paquete de registro (por ejemplo,en productos)deberían crear y utilizar sus propios objetos Logger,con nombres apropiados,para que el registro pueda ser controlado en una granularidad adecuada por cada Logger.Los desarrolladores también deben mantener una referencia firme a sus objetos Logger para evitar que sean desechos recogidos.

trans-unit.source: The "heavyweight" components (those that delegate to a peer, or native component on the host system) are shown with a darker, heavier box. The four heavyweight JFC/Swing containers (JFrame, JDialog, JWindow, and JApplet) are shown in relation to the AWT classes they extend. These four components are the only heavyweight containers in the Swing library. The lightweight container JInternalFrame is also shown. All five of these JFC/Swing containers implement the RootPaneContainer interface, and they all delegate their operations to a JRootPane (shown with a little "handle" on top).

The "no offset" text controls what text is printed when the total amount of the offset fields to be output is zero. Example values would be 'Z', '+00:00', 'UTC' or 'GMT'. Three formats are accepted for parsing UTC - the "no offset" text, and the plus and minus versions of zero defined by the pattern.
trans-unit.target: El texto "no offset" controla qué texto se imprime cuando la cantidad total de los campos de offset a emitir es cero.Los valores de ejemplo serían "Z","+00:00","UTC" o "GMT".Se aceptan tres formatos para analizar UTC:el texto "sin desplazamiento" y las versiones más y menos de cero definidas por el patrón.

The "window activated" event type.
The "window activated" event type. This event indicates that keystrokes and mouse clicks are directed towards this internal frame.
The "window closed" event.
The "window closed" event. This event is delivered after the internal frame has been closed as the result of a call to the setClosed or dispose method.
The "window deactivated" event type.
The "window deactivated" event type. This event indicates that keystrokes and mouse clicks are no longer directed to the internal frame.
The "window deiconified" event type.
The "window deiconified" event type. This event indicates that the internal frame has been restored to its normal size.
The "window iconified" event.
The "window iconified" event. This event indicates that the internal frame was shrunk down to a small icon.
The "window is closing" event.

The "window is closing" event. This event is delivered when the user attempts to close the internal frame, such as by clicking the internal frame's close button, or when a program attempts to close the internal frame by invoking the setClosed method.

The "window is closing" event. This event is delivered when the user attempts to close the window from the window's system menu. If the program does not explicitly hide or dispose the window while processing this event, the window close operation will be cancelled.
The "window opened" event.
The "window opened" event. This event is delivered only the first time the internal frame is made visible.

The '*' and '-' may only be specified in the final segment of a path and must be the only character in that segment. Any query or fragment components of the url are ignored when constructing URLPermissions.
trans-unit.target: El "*" y el "-" sólo pueden ser especificados en el segmento final de un camino y deben ser el único carácter en ese segmento.Cualquier consulta o fragmento de los componentes de la url se ignoran al construir las URLPermissions.

trans-unit.source: The '*' character refers to all resources in the same "directory" - in other words all resources with the same number of path components, and which only differ in the final path component, represented by the '*'.
trans-unit.target: El carácter '*' se refiere a todos los recursos del mismo "directorio",es decir,todos los recursos con el mismo número de componentes de la ruta,y que sólo difieren en el componente final de la ruta,representado por el '*'.

trans-unit.source: The '-' character refers to all resources recursively below the preceding path (e.g. http://www.example.com/a/b/c/d/e.html matches this example).
The '-' character refers to all resources recursively below the preceding path (eg. http://www.oracle.com/a/b/c/d/e.html matches this example).
trans-unit.target: El carácter "-" se refiere a todos los recursos que se encuentran recursivamente por debajo del camino precedente (por ejemplo,http://www.oracle.com/a/b/c/d/e.html coincide con este ejemplo).

trans-unit.source: The '-' is a literal (non-editable) character, and is skipped.
The '_' character represents any single character; the '%' character represents any sequence of zero or more characters.

trans-unit.source: The 14 bit clock sequence value is constructed from the clock sequence field of this UUID. The clock sequence field is used to guarantee temporal uniqueness in a time-based UUID.
trans-unit.target: El valor de la secuencia de reloj de 14 bits se construye a partir del campo de secuencia de reloj de este UUID.El campo de secuencia de reloj se utiliza para garantizar la unicidad temporal en un UUID basado en el tiempo.

trans-unit.source: The 48 bit node value is constructed from the node field of this UUID. This field is intended to hold the IEEE 802 address of the machine that generated this UUID to guarantee spatial uniqueness.
trans-unit.target: El valor del nodo de 48 bits se construye a partir del campo de nodo de este UUID.Este campo está destinado a contener la dirección IEEE 802 de la máquina que generó este UUID para garantizar la unicidad espacial.

trans-unit.source: The 60 bit timestamp value is constructed from the time_low, time_mid, and time_hi fields of this UUID. The resulting timestamp is measured in 100-nanosecond units since midnight, October 15, 1582 UTC.
trans-unit.target: El valor de la marca de tiempo de 60 bits se construye a partir de los campos time_low, time_mid y time_hi de este UUID . La marca de tiempo resultante se mide en unidades de 100 nanosegundos desde la medianoche del 15 de octubre de 1582 UTC.

trans-unit.source: The 8 primitive Java types (boolean, byte, short, int, long, float, double, char) are mapped to the corresponding boxed types from java.lang, namely Boolean, Byte, etc. The Open Type is the corresponding SimpleType. Thus, opentype( long) is SimpleType.LONG, and opendata(long) is java.lang.Long.

The 8 primitive Java types (boolean, byte, short, int, long, float, double, char) are mapped to the corresponding boxed types from java.lang, namely Boolean, Byte, etc. The Open Type is the corresponding SimpleType. Thus, opentype(long) is SimpleType.LONG, and opendata(long) is java.lang.Long.
trans-unit.target: Los 8 tipos primitivos de Java ( boolean , byte , short , int , long , float , double , char ) se asignan a los tipos en caja correspondientes de java.lang , a saber , Boolean , Byte , etc. El Open Type es el SimpleType correspondiente . Por lo tanto, opentype ( long ) es SimpleType.LONG y opendata ( long ) es java.lang.Long .

The defineModulesWithOneLoader and defineModulesWithManyLoaders methods provide convenient ways to create a module layer where all modules are mapped to a single class loader or where each module is mapped to its own class loader. The defineModules method is for more advanced cases where modules are mapped to custom class loaders by means of a function specified to the method. Each of these methods has an instance and static variant. The instance methods create a layer with the receiver as the parent layer. The static methods are for more advanced cases where there can be more than one parent layer or where a Controller is needed to control modules in the layer

The fillInStackTrace() method is called to initialize the stack trace data in the newly created throwable.
The find method scans the input sequence looking for the next subsequence that matches the pattern.

The find and findAll methods defined here can fail for several reasons. These include I/O errors, errors detected parsing a module descriptor (module-info.class), or in the case of ModuleFinder returned by ModuleFinder.of, that two or more modules with the same name are found in a directory. When an error is detected then these methods throw FindException with an appropriate cause. The behavior of a ModuleFinder after a FindException is thrown is undefined. For example, invoking find after an exception is thrown may or may not scan the same modules that lead to the exception. It is recommended that a module finder be discarded after an exception is thrown.

The findInLine(), findWithinHorizon(), skip(), and findAll() methods operate independently of the delimiter pattern. These methods will attempt to match the specified pattern with no regard to delimiters in the input and thus can be used in special circumstances where delimiters are not relevant. These methods may block waiting for more input.
The flags component is a set of flags to indicate how entries are inherited and propagated
The default behavior when no flags are given is the same as for Float and Double.

The getAnnotationsByType(Class) and getDeclaredAnnotationsByType(Class) methods support multiple annotations of the same type on an element. If the argument to either method is a repeatable annotation type (JLS 9.6), then the method will "look through" a container annotation (JLS 9.7), if present, and return any annotations inside the container. Container annotations may be generated at compile-time to wrap multiple annotations of the argument type.

The getBody() method returns a CompletionStage<T> that provides the response body object. The CompletionStage must be obtainable at any time. When it completes depends on the nature of type T. In many cases, when T represents the entire body after being consumed then the CompletionStage completes after the body has been consumed. If T is a streaming type, such as InputStream, then it completes before the body has been read, because the calling code uses the InputStream to consume the data.

The isThreadContentionMonitoringSupported() method can be used to determine if a Java virtual machine supports thread contention monitoring. The thread contention monitoring is disabled by default. The setThreadContentionMonitoringEnabled(boolean) method can be used to enable thread contention monitoring.

The isThreadCpuTimeSupported() method can be used to determine if a Java virtual machine supports measuring of the CPU time for any thread. The isCurrentThreadCpuTimeSupported() method can be used to determine if a Java virtual machine supports measuring of the CPU time for the current thread. A Java virtual machine implementation that supports CPU time measurement for any thread will also support that for the current thread.

The join(InetAddress,NetworkInterface) method is used to join a group and receive all multicast datagrams sent to the group. A channel may join several multicast groups and may join the same group on several interfaces. Membership is dropped by invoking the drop method on the returned MembershipKey. If the underlying platform supports source filtering then the block and unblock methods can be used to block or unblock multicast datagrams from particular source addresses.

The join(InetAddress,NetworkInterface,InetAddress) method is used to begin receiving datagrams sent to a group whose source address matches a given source address. This method throws UnsupportedOperationException if the underlying platform does not support source filtering. Membership is cumulative and this method may be invoked again with the same group and interface to allow receiving datagrams from other source addresses. The method returns a MembershipKey that represents membership to receive datagrams from the given source address. Invoking the key's drop method drops membership so that datagrams from the source address can no longer be received.

The next() and hasNext() methods and their companion methods (such as nextInt() and hasNextInt()) first skip any input that matches the delimiter pattern, and then attempt to return the next token. The tokens() method may also block waiting for input.

The offer method is designed for use when failure is a normal, rather than exceptional occurrence, for example, in fixed-capacity (or "bounded") queues.

The read and write methods defined by this class allow a timeout to be specified when initiating a read or write operation. If the timeout elapses before an operation completes then the operation completes with the exception InterruptedByTimeoutException. A timeout may leave the channel, or the underlying connection, in an inconsistent state. Where the implementation cannot guarantee that bytes have not been read from the channel then it puts the channel into an implementation specific error state. A subsequent attempt to initiate a read operation causes an unspecified runtime exception to be thrown. Similarly if a write operation times out and the implementation cannot guarantee bytes have not been written to the channel then further attempts to write to the channel cause an unspecified runtime exception to be thrown. When a timeout elapses then the state of the ByteBuffer, or the sequence of buffers, for the I/O operation is not defined. Buffers should be discarded or at least care must be taken to ensure that the buffers are not accessed while the channel remains open. All methods that accept timeout parameters treat values less than or equal to zero to mean that the I/O operation does not timeout.

The readAttributes method is used to read the file's attributes. The file owner is represented by a UserPrincipal that is the identity of the file owner for the purposes of access control. The group-owner, represented by a GroupPrincipal, is the identity of the group owner, where a group is an identity created for administrative purposes so as to determine the access rights for the members of the group.
The redirectErrorStream() of each ProcessBuilder applies to the respective process. If set to true, the error stream is written to the same stream as standard output.

The remove() and poll() methods remove and return the head of the queue. Exactly which element is removed from the queue is a function of the queue's ordering policy, which differs from implementation to implementation. The remove() and poll() methods differ only in their behavior when the queue is empty: the remove() method throws an exception, while the poll() method returns null.
The removeEldestEntry(Map.Entry) method may be overridden to impose a policy for removing stale mappings automatically when new mappings are added to the map.

The setPage method can be used to initialize the component from a URL. In this case, the content type will be determined from the URL, and the registered EditorKit for that content type will be set.
The setText method can be used to initialize the component from a string. In this case the current EditorKit will be used, and the content type will be expected to be of this type.

The shutdown method is used to initiate an orderly shutdown of a group. An orderly shutdown marks the group as shutdown; further attempts to construct a channel that binds to the group will throw ShutdownChannelGroupException. Whether or not a group is shutdown can be tested using the isShutdown method. Once shutdown, the group terminates when all asynchronous channels that are bound to the group are closed, all actively executing completion handlers have run to completion, and resources used by the group are released. No attempt is made to stop or interrupt threads that are executing completion handlers. The isTerminated method is used to test if the group has terminated, and the awaitTermination method can be used to block until the group has terminated.

The shutdownNow method can be used to initiate a forceful shutdown of the group. In addition to the actions performed by an orderly shutdown, the shutdownNow method closes all open channels in the group as if by invoking the close method.

The startPipeline method can be invoked to create a pipeline of new processes that send the output of each process directly to the next process. Each process has the attributes of its respective ProcessBuilder.

The walk method opens a sequential stream of StackFrames for the current thread and then applies the given function to walk the StackFrame stream. The stream reports stack frame elements in order, from the top most frame that represents the execution point at which the stack was generated to the bottom most frame. The StackFrame stream is closed when the walk method returns. If an attempt is made to reuse the closed stream, IllegalStateException will be thrown.

The withChronology method returns a new formatter that overrides the chronology. If overridden, the date-time value is converted to the chronology before formatting. During parsing the date-time value is converted to the chronology before it is returned.
The withDecimalStyle method returns a new formatter that overrides the DecimalStyle. The DecimalStyle symbols are used for formatting and parsing.

The withLocale method returns a new formatter that overrides the locale. The locale affects some aspects of formatting and parsing. For example, the ofLocalizedDate provides a formatter that uses the locale specific date format.

The withResolverFields(TemporalField...) parameter allows the set of fields that will be resolved to be filtered before resolving starts. For example, if the formatter has parsed a year, month, day-of-month and day-of-year, then there are two approaches to resolve a date: (year + month + day-of-month) and (year + day-of-year). The resolver fields allows one of the two approaches to be selected. If no resolver fields are set then both approaches must result in the same date.

The withZone method returns a new formatter that overrides the zone. If overridden, the date-time value is converted to a ZonedDateTime with the requested ZoneId before formatting. During parsing the ZoneId is applied before the value is returned.

trans-unit.source: The Files class defines methods that operate on file attributes including file permissions. This may be used when finer manipulation of file permissions is required.
trans-unit.target: La clase Files define métodos que operan en atributos de archivo, incluidos los permisos de archivo. Esto se puede utilizar cuando se requiere una manipulación más precisa de los permisos de archivo.

trans-unit.source: The Files.createTempFile method provides an alternative method to create an empty file in the temporary-file directory. Files created by that method may have more restrictive access permissions to files created by this method and so may be more suited to security-sensitive applications.

Los archivos creados con ese método pueden tener permisos de acceso más restrictivos a los archivos creados con este método y, por lo tanto, pueden ser más adecuados para aplicaciones sensibles a la seguridad.

trans-unit.source: The java.nio.file package defines interfaces and classes for the Java virtual machine to access files, file attributes, and file systems. This API may be used to overcome many of the limitations of the java.io.File class. The toPath method may be used to obtain a Path that uses the abstract path represented by a File object to locate a file. The resulting Path may be used with the Files class to provide more efficient and extensive access to additional file operations, file attributes, and I/O exceptions to help diagnose errors when an operation on a file fails.

This API may be used to overcome many of the limitations of the java.io.File class. The toPath method may be used to obtain a Path that uses the abstract path represented by a File object to locate a file. The resulting Path may be used with the Files class to provide more efficient and extensive access to additional file operations, file attributes, and I/O exceptions to help diagnose errors when an operation on a file fails.

Esta API se puede utilizar para superar muchas de las limitaciones de la clase java.io.File . El método toPath se puede utilizar para obtener una Path que usa la ruta abstracta representada por un objeto File para localizar un archivo. La Path resultante se puede utilizar con la clase Files para proporcionar un acceso más eficiente y extenso a operaciones de archivo adicionales, atributos de archivo y excepciones de E / S para ayudar a diagnosticar errores cuando falla una operación en un archivo.

trans-unit.source: The AbstractQueuedSynchronizer class serves as a useful superclass for defining locks and other synchronizers that rely on queuing blocked threads. The AbstractQueuedLongSynchronizer class provides the same functionality but extends support to 64 bits of synchronization state. Both extend class AbstractOwnableSynchronizer, a simple class that helps record the thread currently holding exclusive synchronization. The LockSupport class provides lower-level blocking and unblocking support that is useful for those developers implementing their own customized lock classes.
trans-unit.target: La clase AbstractQueuedSynchronizer sirve como una superclase útil para definir bloqueos y otros sincronizadores que dependen de la cola de subprocesos bloqueados. La clase AbstractQueuedLongSynchronizer proporciona la misma funcionalidad pero extiende el soporte a 64 bits de estado de sincronización. Ambos amplían la clase AbstractOwnableSynchronizer , una clase simple que ayuda a registrar el hilo que actualmente tiene sincronización exclusiva. La clase LockSupport proporciona soporte de bloqueo y desbloqueo de nivel inferior que es útil para aquellos desarrolladores que implementan sus propias clases de bloqueo personalizadas.

trans-unit.source: The checkPermission method determines whether the access request indicated by a specified permission should be granted or denied. A sample call appears below. In this example, checkPermission will determine whether or not to grant "read" access to the file named "testFile" in the "/temp" directory.
trans-unit.target: El método checkPermission determina si la solicitud de acceso indicada por un permiso especificado debe concederse o denegarse. A continuación, aparece una llamada de muestra. En este ejemplo, checkPermission determinará si concede o no acceso de "lectura" al archivo llamado "testFile" en el directorio "/ temp".

trans-unit.source: The AccessibleAction interface should be supported by any object that can perform one or more actions. This interface provides the standard mechanism for an assistive technology to determine what those actions are as well as tell the object to perform those actions. Any object that can be manipulated should support this interface.
The AccessibleBundle.toDisplayString() method allows you to obtain the localized string for a locale independent key from a predefined ResourceBundle for the keys defined in this class.

The AccessibleComponent interface should be supported by any object that is rendered on the screen. This interface provides the standard mechanism for an assistive technology to determine and set the graphical representation of an object.

The AccessibleHypertext interface should be supported by any object that presents hypertext information on the display. This interface provides the standard mechanism for an assistive technology to access that text via its content, attributes, and spatial location. It also provides standard mechanisms for manipulating hyperlinks. Applications can determine if an object supports the AccessibleHypertext interface by first obtaining its AccessibleContext (see Accessible) and then calling the AccessibleContext.getAccessibleText() method of AccessibleContext. If the return value is a class which extends AccessibleHypertext, then that object supports AccessibleHypertext.

The AccessibleSelection interface provides the standard mechanism for an assistive technology to determine what the current selected children are, as well as modify the selection set. Any object that has children that can be selected should support this the AccessibleSelection interface.

The AccessibleValue interface should be supported by any object that supports a numerical value (e.g., a scroll bar). This interface provides the standard mechanism for an assistive technology to determine and set the numerical value as well as get the minimum and maximum values.
The flags component is a set of flags to indicate how entries are inherited and propagated

trans-unit.source: The AclFileAttributeView class defines methods to read and write the Access Control List (ACL) file attribute. The ACL model used by this file attribute view is based on the model defined by RFC 3530: Network File System (NFS) version 4 Protocol.
trans-unit.target: La clase AclFileAttributeView define métodos para leer y escribir el atributo de archivo de lista de control de acceso (ACL). El modelo de ACL utilizado por esta vista de atributos de archivo se basa en el modelo definido por RFC 3530: Protocolo de versión 4 del sistema de archivos de red (NFS) .

The getAnnotationsByType(Class) and getDeclaredAnnotationsByType(Class) methods support multiple annotations of the same type on an element. If the argument to either method is a repeatable annotation type (JLS 9.6), then the method will "look through" a container annotation (JLS 9.7), if present, and return any annotations inside the container. Container annotations may be generated at compile-time to wrap multiple annotations of the argument type.
trans-unit.target: Los getAnnotationsByType(Class) y getDeclaredAnnotationsByType(Class) admiten varias anotaciones del mismo tipo en un elemento. Si el argumento de cualquiera de los métodos es un tipo de anotación repetible (JLS 9.6), entonces el método "revisará" una anotación de contenedor (JLS 9.7), si está presente, y devolverá las anotaciones dentro del contenedor. Las anotaciones de contenedor se pueden generar en tiempo de compilación para envolver múltiples anotaciones del tipo de argumento.

trans-unit.source: The shutdown method is used to initiate an orderly shutdown of a group. An orderly shutdown marks the group as shutdown; further attempts to construct a channel that binds to the group will throw ShutdownChannelGroupException. Whether or not a group is shutdown can be tested using the isShutdown method. Once shutdown, the group terminates when all asynchronous channels that are bound to the group are closed, all actively executing completion handlers have run to completion, and resources used by the group are released. No attempt is made to stop or interrupt threads that are executing completion handlers. The isTerminated method is used to test if the group has terminated, and the awaitTermination method can be used to block until the group has terminated.
trans-unit.target: El método de shutdown se utiliza para iniciar un apagado ordenado de un grupo. Un cierre ordenado marca al grupo como cerrado; los intentos posteriores de construir un canal que se vincule al grupo arrojarán ShutdownChannelGroupException . Se puede probar si un grupo está apagado o no mediante el método isShutdown . Una vez apagado, el grupo termina cuando se cierran todos los canales asíncronos que están vinculados al grupo, todos los controladores de finalización que se ejecutan activamente se han completado y los recursos utilizados por el grupo se liberan. No se intenta detener o interrumpir los subprocesos que están ejecutando controladores de finalización. El método isTerminated se utiliza para probar si el grupo ha terminado y el awaitTermination método awaitTermination se puede utilizar para bloquear hasta que el grupo haya terminado.

trans-unit.source: The shutdownNow method can be used to initiate a forceful shutdown of the group. In addition to the actions performed by an orderly shutdown, the shutdownNow method closes all open channels in the group as if by invoking the close method.
trans-unit.target: El método shutdownNow se puede utilizar para iniciar un cierre forzoso del grupo. Además de las acciones realizadas por un cierre ordenado, el método shutdownNow cierra todos los canales abiertos en el grupo como si se invocara el método de close .

trans-unit.source: The read and write methods defined by this class allow a timeout to be specified when initiating a read or write operation. If the timeout elapses before an operation completes then the operation completes with the exception InterruptedByTimeoutException. A timeout may leave the channel, or the underlying connection, in an inconsistent state. Where the implementation cannot guarantee that bytes have not been read from the channel then it puts the channel into an implementation specific error state. A subsequent attempt to initiate a read operation causes an unspecified runtime exception to be thrown. Similarly if a write operation times out and the implementation cannot guarantee bytes have not been written to the channel then further attempts to write to the channel cause an unspecified runtime exception to be thrown. When a timeout elapses then the state of the ByteBuffer, or the sequence of buffers, for the I/O operation is not defined. Buffers should be discarded or at least care must be taken to ensure that the buffers are not accessed while the channel remains open. All methods that accept timeout parameters treat values less than or equal to zero to mean that the I/O operation does not timeout.
trans-unit.target: Los métodos de read y write definidos por esta clase permiten especificar un tiempo de espera al iniciar una operación de lectura o escritura. Si transcurre el tiempo de espera antes de que se complete una operación, la operación se completa con la excepción InterruptedByTimeoutException . Un tiempo de espera puede dejar el canal, o la conexión subyacente, en un estado inconsistente. Cuando la implementación no puede garantizar que no se hayan leído bytes del canal, el canal entra en un estado de error específico de la implementación . Un intento posterior de iniciar una operación de read provoca que se lance una excepción de tiempo de ejecución no especificada. Del mismo modo, si una write el tiempo de espera de la operación se agota y la implementación no puede garantizar que los bytes no se hayan escrito en el canal, luego los intentos posteriores de write en el canal provocan que se lance una excepción de tiempo de ejecución no especificada. Cuando transcurre un tiempo de espera, el estado de ByteBuffer , o la secuencia de búferes, para la operación de E / S no está definido. Los búferes deben descartarse o al menos se debe tener cuidado para garantizar que no se acceda a los búferes mientras el canal permanece abierto. Todos los métodos que aceptan parámetros de tiempo de espera tratan los valores menores o iguales a cero para significar que la operación de E / S no se agota.

trans-unit.source: The AtomicIntegerArray, AtomicLongArray, and AtomicReferenceArray classes further extend atomic operation support to arrays of these types. These classes are also notable in providing volatile access semantics for their array elements, which is not supported for ordinary arrays.
trans-unit.target: Las AtomicIntegerArray , AtomicLongArray y AtomicReferenceArray amplían aún más el soporte de operaciones atómicas a matrices de estos tipos. Estas clases también son notables por proporcionar semántica de acceso volatile para sus elementos de matriz, que no es compatible con matrices ordinarias.

trans-unit.source: The AtomicIntegerArray, AtomicLongArray, and AtomicReferenceArray classes further extend atomic operation support to arrays of these types. These classes are also notable in providing volatile access semantics for their array elements.

The AtomicMarkableReference class associates a single boolean with a reference. For example, this bit might be used inside a data structure to mean that the object being referenced has logically been deleted. The AtomicStampedReference class associates an integer value with a reference. This may be used for example, to represent version numbers corresponding to series of updates.
trans-unit.target: La clase AtomicMarkableReference asocia un único booleano con una referencia. Por ejemplo, este bit podría usarse dentro de una estructura de datos para significar que el objeto al que se hace referencia se ha eliminado lógicamente. La clase AtomicStampedReference asocia un valor entero con una referencia. Esto puede usarse, por ejemplo, para representar números de versión correspondientes a series de actualizaciones.

The BasicFileAttributeView class defines methods to read and update a basic set of file attributes that are common to many file systems.

trans-unit.source: The Channel interface is extended by several other interfaces.
trans-unit.target: La interfaz del Channel se amplía con varias otras interfaces.

trans-unit.source: The Channels utility class defines static methods that support the interoperation of the stream classes of the java.io package with the channel classes of this package. An appropriate channel can be constructed from an InputStream or an OutputStream, and conversely an InputStream or an OutputStream can be constructed from a channel. A Reader can be constructed that uses a given charset to decode bytes from a given readable byte channel, and conversely a Writer can be constructed that uses a given charset to encode characters into bytes and write them to a given writable byte channel.

The Channels utility class defines static methods that support the interoperation of the stream classes of the java.io package with the channel classes of this package. An appropriate channel can be constructed from an InputStream or an OutputStream, and conversely an InputStream or an OutputStream can be constructed from a channel. A Reader can be constructed that uses a given charset to decode bytes from a given readable byte channel, and conversely a Writer can be constructed that uses a given charset to encode characters into bytes and write them to a given writable byte channel.
trans-unit.target: La clase de utilidad Channels define métodos estáticos que admiten la interoperación de las clases de flujo del paquete java.io con las clases de canal de este paquete. Se puede construir un canal apropiado a partir de un InputStream o un OutputStream y, a la inversa, un InputStream o un OutputStream se pueden construir a partir de un canal. Se puede construir un Reader que use un juego de caracteres dado para decodificar bytes de un canal de bytes legibles dado y, a la inversa, se puede construir un Writer que use un juego de caracteres dado para codificar caracteres en bytes y escribirlos en un canal de bytes de escritura dado.

trans-unit.source: The Charset class defines methods for creating coders for a given charset and for retrieving the various names associated with a charset. It also defines static methods for testing whether a particular charset is supported, for locating charset instances by name, and for constructing a map that contains every charset for which support is available in the current Java virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: La clase Charset define métodos para crear codificadores para un juego de caracteres dado y para recuperar los diversos nombres asociados con un juego de caracteres. También define métodos estáticos para probar si un juego de caracteres en particular es compatible, para ubicar instancias de juegos de caracteres por nombre y para construir un mapa que contenga cada juego de caracteres para el que haya soporte disponible en la máquina virtual Java actual.

trans-unit.source: The builtin class loaders do not explicitly define Package objects for packages in named modules. Instead those packages are automatically defined and have no specification and implementation versioning information.
The ConcurrentLinkedQueue class supplies an efficient scalable thread-safe non-blocking FIFO queue. The ConcurrentLinkedDeque class is similar, but additionally supports the Deque interface.
trans-unit.target: La clase ConcurrentLinkedQueue proporciona una cola FIFO sin bloqueo, segura para subprocesos, escalable y eficiente. La clase ConcurrentLinkedDeque es similar, pero además es compatible con la interfaz Deque .

trans-unit.source: The Condition interface describes condition variables that may be associated with Locks. These are similar in usage to the implicit monitors accessed using Object.wait, but offer extended capabilities. In particular, multiple Condition objects may be associated with a single Lock. To avoid compatibility issues, the names of Condition methods are different from the corresponding Object versions.
trans-unit.target: La Condition interfaz describe variables de condición que pueden estar asociados con las cerraduras. Estos son similares en uso a los monitores implícitos a los que se accede mediante Object.wait , pero ofrecen capacidades ampliadas. En particular, se pueden asociar varios objetos Condition con un solo Lock . Para evitar problemas de compatibilidad, los nombres de los métodos de Condition son diferentes de las versiones de Object correspondientes .

trans-unit.source: The ISO_LOCAL_DATE
trans-unit.target: El ISO_LOCAL_DATE

trans-unit.source: The ISO_LOCAL_DATE_TIME
trans-unit.target: El ISO_LOCAL_DATE_TIME

trans-unit.source: The ISO_LOCAL_TIME
trans-unit.target: El ISO_LOCAL_TIME

trans-unit.source: The ISO_OFFSET_DATE_TIME
trans-unit.target: El ISO_OFFSET_DATE_TIME

trans-unit.source: The ISO_OFFSET_DATE_TIME where the instant is converted from ChronoField.INSTANT_SECONDS and ChronoField.NANO_OF_SECOND using the UTC offset. Parsing is case insensitive.
trans-unit.target: El ISO_OFFSET_DATE_TIME donde el instante se convierte de ChronoField.INSTANT_SECONDS y ChronoField.NANO_OF_SECOND usando el desplazamiento UTC . El análisis no distingue entre mayúsculas y minúsculas.

trans-unit.source: The withChronology method returns a new formatter that overrides the chronology. If overridden, the date-time value is converted to the chronology before formatting. During parsing the date-time value is converted to the chronology before it is returned.
trans-unit.target: El método withChronology devuelve un nuevo formateador que anula la cronología. Si se reemplaza, el valor de fecha y hora se convierte a la cronología antes de formatear. Durante el análisis, el valor de fecha y hora se convierte a la cronología antes de que se devuelva.

trans-unit.source: The withDecimalStyle method returns a new formatter that overrides the DecimalStyle. The DecimalStyle symbols are used for formatting and parsing.
trans-unit.target: El método withDecimalStyle devuelve un nuevo formateador que anula DecimalStyle . Los símbolos DecimalStyle se utilizan para formatear y analizar.

trans-unit.source: The withLocale method returns a new formatter that overrides the locale. The locale affects some aspects of formatting and parsing. For example, the ofLocalizedDate provides a formatter that uses the locale specific date format.
trans-unit.target: El método withLocale devuelve un nuevo formateador que anula la configuración regional. La configuración regional afecta algunos aspectos del formato y el análisis. Por ejemplo, ofLocalizedDate proporciona un formateador que usa el formato de fecha específico de la configuración regional.

trans-unit.source: The withResolverFields(TemporalField...) parameter allows the set of fields that will be resolved to be filtered before resolving starts. For example, if the formatter has parsed a year, month, day-of-month and day-of-year, then there are two approaches to resolve a date: (year + month + day-of-month) and (year + day-of-year). The resolver fields allows one of the two approaches to be selected. If no resolver fields are set then both approaches must result in the same date.
trans-unit.target: El withResolverFields(TemporalField...) permite filtrar el conjunto de campos que se resolverán antes de que comience la resolución. Por ejemplo, si el formateador ha analizado un año, mes, día del mes y día del año, existen dos enfoques para resolver una fecha: (año + mes + día del mes) y (año + día del año). Los campos de resolución permiten seleccionar uno de los dos enfoques. Si no se establecen campos de resolución, ambos enfoques deben dar como resultado la misma fecha.

trans-unit.source: The withZone method returns a new formatter that overrides the zone. If overridden, the date-time value is converted to a ZonedDateTime with the requested ZoneId before formatting. During parsing the ZoneId is applied before the value is returned.
trans-unit.target: El método withZone devuelve un nuevo formateador que anula la zona. Si se reemplaza, el valor de fecha y hora se convierte en un ZonedDateTime con el ZoneId solicitado antes de formatear. Durante el análisis, se aplica ZoneId antes de que se devuelva el valor.

trans-unit.source: The Descriptor for all of the MBeanAttributeInfo, MBeanParameterInfo, and MBeanOperationInfo objects contained in the MBeanInfo will have a field openType whose value is the OpenType specified by the mapping rules above. So even when getType() is "int", getDescriptor().getField("openType") will be SimpleType.INTEGER.
trans-unit.target: El Descriptor para todos los MBeanAttributeInfo , MBeanParameterInfo y MBeanOperationInfo contenidos en MBeanInfo tendrá un campo openType cuyo valor es el OpenType especificado por las reglas de mapeo anteriores. Entonces, incluso cuando getType() es " int ", getDescriptor().getField("openType") será SimpleType.INTEGER .

trans-unit.source: The DocFlavor class represents the print data format, such as JPEG or PostScript. A DocFlavor object consists of a MIME type, which describes the format, and a document representation class name that indicates how the document is delivered to the printer or output stream. An application uses the DocFlavor and an attribute set to find printers that can print the document type specified by the DocFlavor and have the capabilities specified by the attribute set.
trans-unit.target: La clase DocFlavor representa el formato de datos de impresión, como JPEG o PostScript. Un objeto DocFlavor consta de un tipo MIME, que describe el formato, y un nombre de clase de representación del documento que indica cómo se envía el documento a la impresora o al flujo de salida. Una aplicación utiliza DocFlavor y un conjunto de atributos para encontrar impresoras que puedan imprimir el tipo de documento especificado por DocFlavor y que tengan las capacidades especificadas por el conjunto de atributos.

trans-unit.source: The DocletEnvironment instance holds the environment that the doclet will be initialized with. From this environment all other information can be extracted, in the form of elements. One can further use the APIs and utilities described by Language Model API to query Elements and Types.

The DOMLocator node may be passed to TransformerException objects, and retrieved by trying to cast the result of the TransformerException.getLocator() method. The implementation has no responsibility to use a DOMLocator instead of a SourceLocator (though line numbers and the like do not make much sense for a DOM), so the result of getLocator must always be tested with an instanceof.

The DOMResult class allows a Node to be specified to which result DOM nodes will be appended. If an output node is not specified, the transformer will use DocumentBuilder.newDocument() to create an output Document node. If a node is specified, it should be one of the following: Document, Element, or DocumentFragment. Specification of any other node type is implementation dependent and undefined by this API. If the result is a Document, the output of the transformation must have a single element root to set as the document element.

The DOMSource class allows the client of the implementation of this API to specify a DOM Node as the source of the input tree. The model of how the Transformer deals with the DOM tree in terms of mismatches with the XSLT data model or other data models is beyond the scope of this document. Any of the nodes derived from Node are legal input.

The DOMSource class allows the client of the implementation of this API to specify a DOM Node as the source of the input tree. The model of how the Transformer deals with the DOM tree in terms of mismatches with the XSLT data model or other data models is beyond the scope of this document. Any of the nodes derived from Node are legal input.

The DosFileAttributeView class extends BasicFileAttributeView by defining methods to access the legacy "DOS" file attributes supported on file systems such as File Allocation Tabl (FAT), commonly used in consumer devices.
trans-unit.target: La clase DosFileAttributeView amplía BasicFileAttributeView definiendo métodos para acceder a los atributos de archivo heredados "DOS" admitidos en sistemas de archivos como File Allocation Tabl (FAT), comúnmente utilizado en dispositivos de consumo.

trans-unit.source: The DosFileAttributeView class extends BasicFileAttributeView by defining methods to access the legacy "DOS" file attributes supported on file systems such as File Allocation Table (FAT), commonly used in consumer devices.
The Executors class contains utility methods to convert from other common forms to Callable classes.
trans-unit.target: La clase Executors contiene métodos de utilidad para convertir de otras formas comunes a clases Callable .

trans-unit.source: The Executors class provides convenient factory methods for the ScheduledExecutorService implementations provided in this package.
trans-unit.target: La clase Executors proporciona métodos de fábrica convenientes para las implementaciones ScheduledExecutorService proporcionadas en este paquete.

trans-unit.source: The Executors class provides factory methods for the executor services provided in this package.
trans-unit.target: La clase Executors proporciona métodos de fábrica para los servicios ejecutores proporcionados en este paquete.

trans-unit.source: The Executors.defaultThreadFactory() method provides a more useful simple implementation, that sets the created thread context to known values before returning it.
The Executors.defaultThreadFactory() method provides a more useful simple implementation, that sets the created thread context to known values before returning it.
trans-unit.target: El método Executors.defaultThreadFactory() proporciona una implementación simple más útil, que establece el contexto del hilo creado en valores conocidos antes de devolverlo.

trans-unit.source: The short description for the bean descriptor of the annotated class.
The short description for the descriptor of the annotated property.
The FileAttribute interface represents the value of an attribute for cases where the attribute value is required to be set atomically when creating an object in the file system.
trans-unit.target: La interfaz FileAttribute representa el valor de un atributo para los casos en los que se requiere que el valor del atributo se establezca de forma atómica al crear un objeto en el sistema de archivos.

trans-unit.source: The FileChannel class supports the usual operations of reading bytes from, and writing bytes to, a channel connected to a file, as well as those of querying and modifying the current file position and truncating the file to a specific size. It defines methods for acquiring locks on the whole file or on a specific region of a file; these methods return instances of the FileLock class. Finally, it defines methods for forcing updates to the file to be written to the storage device that contains it, for efficiently transferring bytes between the file and other channels, and for mapping a region of the file directly into memory.
trans-unit.target: La clase FileChannel admite las operaciones habituales de leer bytes de y escribir bytes en un canal conectado a un archivo, así como las de consultar y modificar la posición actual del archivo y truncar el archivo a un tamaño específico. Define métodos para adquirir bloqueos en todo el archivo o en una región específica de un archivo; estos métodos devuelven instancias de la clase FileLock . Finalmente, define métodos para forzar que las actualizaciones del archivo se escriban en el dispositivo de almacenamiento que lo contiene, para transferir bytes de manera eficiente entre el archivo y otros canales y para mapear una región del archivo directamente en la memoria.

trans-unit.source: The getOwner or setOwner methods may be used to read or update the owner of the file.
trans-unit.target: Los métodos getOwner o setOwner pueden usarse para leer o actualizar el propietario del archivo.

trans-unit.source: The Filer interface discusses restrictions on how processors can operate on files.
trans-unit.target: La interfaz de Filer analiza las restricciones sobre cómo los procesadores pueden operar en los archivos.

trans-unit.source: The supportsFileAttributeView(String) method may be used to test if an underlying FileStore supports the file attributes identified by a file attribute view.
The supportsFileAttributeView(String) method may be used to test if an underlying FileStore supports the file attributes identified by a file attribute view.
trans-unit.target: El método supportsFileAttributeView(String) se puede utilizar para probar si un FileStore subyacente admite los atributos de archivo identificados por una vista de atributos de archivo.

trans-unit.source: The getFileStores method returns an iterator over the underlying file-stores.
trans-unit.target: El método getFileStores devuelve un iterador sobre los file-stores subyacentes .

trans-unit.source: The getPath method converts a system dependent path string, returning a Path object that may be used to locate and access a file.
trans-unit.target: El método getPath convierte una cadena de ruta dependiente del sistema , devolviendo un objeto Path que puede usarse para ubicar y acceder a un archivo.

trans-unit.source: The getPathMatcher method is used to create a PathMatcher that performs match operations on paths.
trans-unit.target: El método getPathMatcher se utiliza para crear un PathMatcher que realiza operaciones de coincidencia en rutas.

trans-unit.source: The getUserPrincipalLookupService method returns the UserPrincipalLookupService to lookup users or groups by name.
trans-unit.target: El método getUserPrincipalLookupService devuelve UserPrincipalLookupService para buscar usuarios o grupos por nombre.

trans-unit.source: The newWatchService method creates a WatchService that may be used to watch objects for changes and events.
trans-unit.target: El método newWatchService crea un WatchService que se puede usar para observar los objetos en busca de cambios y eventos.

trans-unit.source: The format method for this object which has a locale argument does not change this value.
trans-unit.target: El método de format o para este objeto que tiene un argumento de configuración regional no cambia este valor.

The getAllFonts method of the GraphicsEnvironment class returns an array of all font faces available in the system. These font faces are returned as Font objects with a size of 1, identity transform and default font features. These base fonts can then be used to derive new Font objects with varying sizes, styles, transforms and font features via the deriveFont methods in this class.

The HttpExchange class encapsulates everything an application needs to process incoming requests and to generate appropriate responses.

The noBody request body publisher can be used where no request body is required or appropriate. Whether a method is restricted, or not, is implementation specific. For example, some implementations may choose to restrict the CONNECT method.
The HttpResponse using this subscriber is available after the entire response has been read.

The HttpResponse using this subscriber is available immediately after the response headers have been read, without requiring to wait for the entire body to be processed. The response body bytes can then be obtained by subscribing to the publisher returned by the HttpResponsebody method.

The HttpResponse using this subscriber is available immediately after the response headers have been read, without requiring to wait for the entire body to be processed. The response body can then be read directly from the InputStream.

The HttpResponse using this subscriber is available immediately after the response headers have been read, without requiring to wait for the entire body to be processed. The response body can then be read directly from the Stream.

The Input Method Framework lets text components interact with input methods, separate software components that preprocess events to let users enter thousands of different characters using keyboards with far fewer keys. JTextComponent is an active client of the framework, so it implements the preferred user interface for interacting with input methods. As a consequence, some key events do not reach the text component because they are handled by an input method, and some text input reaches the text component as committed text within an InputMethodEvent instead of as a key event. The complete text input is the combination of the characters in keyTyped key events and committed text in input method events.

The Catalog Standard distinguished external identifiers from uri entries as being used to solely identify DTDs, while uri entries for other resources such as stylesheets and schema. The Java APIs, such as XMLResolver and LSResourceResolver however, make no such distinction. In consistent with the existing Java API, this CatalogResolver recognizes a system identifier as a URI and will search both system and uri entries in a catalog in order to find a matching entry.

The Input Method Framework lets text components interact with input methods, separate software components that preprocess events to let users enter thousands of different characters using keyboards with far fewer keys. JTextComponent is an active client of the framework, so it implements the preferred user interface for interacting with input methods. As a consequence, some key events do not reach the text component because they are handled by an input method, and some text input reaches the text component as committed text within an InputMethodEvent instead of as a key event. The complete text input is the combination of the characters in keyTyped key events and committed text in input method events.

The getSourceRegion> method may be used if only source clipping is desired.
trans-unit.target: El método getSourceRegion> puede usarse si solo se desea el recorte de la fuente.

trans-unit.source: The full uncompressed form of an IPv6 literal address is also valid.
trans-unit.target: La forma completa sin comprimir de una dirección literal IPv6 también es válida.

trans-unit.source: The InetAddress class is the abstraction representing an IP (Internet Protocol) address. It has two subclasses:
trans-unit.target: La clase InetAddress es la abstracción que representa una dirección IP (Protocolo de Internet). Tiene dos subclases:

trans-unit.source: The SHOWA era that contains 1970-01-01 (ISO calendar system) has the value 1 Later era is numbered 2 (HEISEI). Earlier eras are numbered 0 (TAISHO), -1 (MEIJI), only Meiji and later eras are supported.
trans-unit.target: La era SHOWA que contiene 1970-01-01 (sistema de calendario ISO) tiene el valor 1 La era posterior se numera 2 ( HEISEI ). Las eras anteriores se numeran 0 ( TAISHO ), -1 ( MEIJI ), solo se admiten las eras Meiji y posteriores.

trans-unit.source: The SHOWA era that contains 1970-01-01 (ISO calendar system) has the value 1. Later eras are numbered from 2 (HEISEI). Earlier eras are numbered 0 (TAISHO), -1 (MEIJI)).
trans-unit.target: La era SHOWA que contiene 1970-01-01 (sistema de calendario ISO) tiene el valor 1. Las eras posteriores se numeran desde 2 ( HEISEI ). Las eras anteriores se numeran 0 ( TAISHO ), -1 ( MEIJI )).

trans-unit.source: The ConnectionState bound property name.

The jdk.jshell.execution package contains implementations of the interfaces in jdk.jshell.spi. Otherwise, the four packages are independent, operate at different levels, and do not share functionality or definitions.
The jdk.jshell is the package for creating 'snippet' evaluating tools. Generally, this is only package that would be needed for creating tools.

The jdk.jshell.spi package specifies a Service Provider Interface (SPI) for defining execution engine implementations for tools based on the jdk.jshell API. The jdk.jshell.execution package provides standard implementations of jdk.jshell.spi interfaces and supporting code. It also serves as a library of functionality for defining new execution engine implementations.
The jdk.jshell.tool package supports programmatically launching the jshell tool.
The removeEldestEntry(Map.Entry) method may be overridden to impose a policy for removing stale mappings automatically when new mappings are added to the map.
trans-unit.target: El removeEldestEntry(Map.Entry) puede anularse para imponer una política para eliminar automáticamente las asignaciones obsoletas cuando se agregan nuevas asignaciones al mapa.

trans-unit.source: The LocateRegistry class provides a programmatic API for constructing a bootstrap reference to a Registry at a remote address (see the static getRegistry methods) and for creating and exporting a Registry in the current VM on a particular local address (see the static createRegistry methods).

The Lock interface supports locking disciplines that differ in semantics (reentrant, fair, etc), and that can be used in non-block-structured contexts including hand-over-hand and lock reordering algorithms. The main implementation is ReentrantLock.
trans-unit.target: Los Lock soportes de interfaz disciplinas que difieren en la semántica (reentrante, justo, etc) de bloqueo, y que puede utilizarse en contextos no de bloque estructurado incluyendo mano sobre mano y algoritmos de bloqueo de reordenación. La implementación principal es ReentrantLock .

trans-unit.source: The ManagementFactory class is the management factory class for the Java platform. This class provides a set of static factory methods to obtain the MXBeans for the Java platform to allow an application to access the MXBeans directly.
trans-unit.target: La clase ManagementFactory es la clase de fábrica de gestión para la plataforma Java. Esta clase proporciona un conjunto de métodos de fábrica estáticos para obtener los MXBeans para la plataforma Java para permitir que una aplicación acceda a los MXBeans directamente.

trans-unit.source: The getPlatformManagementInterfaces method returns all management interfaces supported in the Java virtual machine including the standard management interfaces listed in the tables below as well as the management interfaces extended by the JDK implementation.
trans-unit.target: El método getPlatformManagementInterfaces devuelve todas las interfaces de gestión admitidas en la máquina virtual Java, incluidas las interfaces de gestión estándar que se enumeran en las tablas siguientes, así como las interfaces de gestión extendidas por la implementación de JDK.

trans-unit.source: The find method scans the input sequence looking for the next subsequence that matches the pattern.
trans-unit.target: El método de find escanea la secuencia de entrada en busca de la siguiente subsecuencia que coincida con el patrón.

trans-unit.source: The lookingAt method attempts to match the input sequence, starting at the beginning, against the pattern.
trans-unit.target: El método lookingAt intenta hacer coincidir la secuencia de entrada, comenzando por el principio, con el patrón.

trans-unit.source: The matches method attempts to match the entire input sequence against the pattern.
trans-unit.target: El método de matches intenta hacer coincidir toda la secuencia de entrada con el patrón.

trans-unit.source: The getUsage() method provides an estimate of the current usage of a memory pool. For a garbage-collected memory pool, the amount of used memory includes the memory occupied by all objects in the pool including both reachable and unreachable objects.
trans-unit.target: El método getUsage() proporciona una estimación del uso actual de un grupo de memoria. Para un grupo de memoria recolectado como basura, la cantidad de memoria utilizada incluye la memoria ocupada por todos los objetos en el grupo, incluidos los objetos accesibles e inalcanzables .

trans-unit.source: The isCollectionUsageThresholdSupported() method can be used to determine if this functionality is supported.
trans-unit.target: El método isCollectionUsageThresholdSupported() se puede utilizar para determinar si esta funcionalidad es compatible.

trans-unit.source: The MethodHandles.lookup() factory method produces a Lookup object with null previous lookup class. lookup.in(D.class) transforms the lookup on class C to class D without elevation of privileges. If C and D are in the same module, lookup2 records D as the new lookup class and keeps the same previous lookup class as the original lookup, or null if not present.
