The join(InetAddress,NetworkInterface) method is used to join a group and receive all multicast datagrams sent to the group. A channel may join several multicast groups and may join the same group on several interfaces. Membership is dropped by invoking the drop method on the returned MembershipKey. If the underlying platform supports source filtering then the block and unblock methods can be used to block or unblock multicast datagrams from particular source addresses.
trans-unit.target: El método join(InetAddress,NetworkInterface) se utiliza para unirse a un grupo y recibir todos los datagramas de multidifusión enviados al grupo. Un canal puede unirse a varios grupos de multidifusión y puede unirse al mismo grupo en varias interfaces . La membresía se elimina invocando el método drop en la MembershipKey devuelta . Si la plataforma subyacente admite el filtrado de origen, entonces los métodos de block y unblock se pueden usar para bloquear o desbloquear datagramas de multidifusión de direcciones de origen particulares.

trans-unit.source: The join(InetAddress,NetworkInterface,InetAddress) method is used to begin receiving datagrams sent to a group whose source address matches a given source address. This method throws UnsupportedOperationException if the underlying platform does not support source filtering. Membership is cumulative and this method may be invoked again with the same group and interface to allow receiving datagrams from other source addresses. The method returns a MembershipKey that represents membership to receive datagrams from the given source address. Invoking the key's drop method drops membership so that datagrams from the source address can no longer be received.
trans-unit.target: El método join(InetAddress,NetworkInterface,InetAddress) se utiliza para comenzar a recibir datagramas enviados a un grupo cuya dirección de origen coincide con una dirección de origen determinada. Este método arroja UnsupportedOperationException si la plataforma subyacente no admite el filtrado de origen. La membresía es acumulativa y este método puede invocarse nuevamente con el mismo grupo e interfaz para permitir recibir datagramas de otras direcciones de origen. El método devuelve una MembershipKey que representa la membresía para recibir datagramas de la dirección de origen dada. Invocar el método de drop la clave elimina la membresía, por lo que los datagramas de la dirección de origen ya no se pueden recibir.

trans-unit.source: The syncAll operation provides a way to force threads to accept a new target value, even if there is no other synchronization.
trans-unit.target: La operación syncAll proporciona una forma de obligar a los subprocesos a aceptar un nuevo valor objetivo, incluso si no hay otra sincronización.

trans-unit.source: The NetworkChannel interface specifies methods to bind the channel's socket, obtain the address to which the socket is bound, and methods to get and set socket options. The MulticastChannel interface specifies methods to join Internet Protocol (IP) multicast groups.

The NetworkChannel interface specifies methods to bind the channel's socket, obtain the address to which the socket is bound, and methods to get and set socket options. The MulticastChannel interface specifies methods to join Internet Protocol (IP) multicast groups.
trans-unit.target: La interfaz NetworkChannel especifica métodos para bind el socket del canal, obtener la dirección a la que está vinculado el socket y métodos para get y set opciones de socket. La interfaz MulticastChannel especifica métodos para unirse a grupos de multidifusión de Protocolo de Internet (IP).

trans-unit.source: The bind and setOption methods that do not otherwise have a value to return are specified to return the network channel upon which they are invoked. This allows method invocations to be chained. Implementations of this interface should specialize the return type so that method invocations on the implementation class can be chained.
trans-unit.target: Los métodos bind y setOption que de otro modo no tienen un valor para devolver se especifican para devolver el canal de red en el que se invocan. Esto permite encadenar las invocaciones de métodos. Las implementaciones de esta interfaz deben especializar el tipo de retorno para que las invocaciones de métodos en la clase de implementación se puedan encadenar.

trans-unit.source: The NetworkInterface class provides APIs to browse and query all the networking interfaces (e.g. ethernet connection or PPP endpoint) of the local machine. It is through that class that you can check if any of the local interfaces is configured to support IPv6.
trans-unit.target: La clase NetworkInterface proporciona API para explorar y consultar todas las interfaces de red (por ejemplo, conexión Ethernet o punto final PPP) de la máquina local. Es a través de esa clase que puede verificar si alguna de las interfaces locales está configurada para admitir IPv6.

trans-unit.source: The getSignature() method should return at runtime an array of instances of a subclass of MBeanParameterInfo which implements the OpenMBeanParameterInfo interface (typically OpenMBeanParameterInfoSupport).
trans-unit.target: El método getSignature() debe devolver en tiempo de ejecución una matriz de instancias de una subclase de MBeanParameterInfo que implementa la interfaz OpenMBeanParameterInfo (normalmente OpenMBeanParameterInfoSupport ).

trans-unit.source: The getAttributes(), getOperations() and getConstructors() methods of the implementing class should return at runtime an array of instances of a subclass of MBeanAttributeInfo, MBeanOperationInfo or MBeanConstructorInfo respectively which implement the OpenMBeanAttributeInfo, OpenMBeanOperationInfo or OpenMBeanConstructorInfo interface respectively.
trans-unit.target: Los getAttributes() , getOperations() y getConstructors() métodos de la clase que implementa deben volver en tiempo de ejecución un conjunto de instancias de una subclase de MBeanAttributeInfo , MBeanOperationInfo o MBeanConstructorInfo respectivamente que implementan la OpenMBeanAttributeInfo , OpenMBeanOperationInfo o OpenMBeanConstructorInfo interfaz respectivamente.

trans-unit.source: The getSignature() method should return at runtime an array of instances of a subclass of MBeanParameterInfo which implements the OpenMBeanParameterInfo interface (typically OpenMBeanParameterInfoSupport).
trans-unit.target: El método getSignature() debe devolver en tiempo de ejecución una matriz de instancias de una subclase de MBeanParameterInfo que implementa la interfaz OpenMBeanParameterInfo (normalmente OpenMBeanParameterInfoSupport ).

trans-unit.source: The PathIterator interface has more detailed descriptions of the types of segments that make up a path and the winding rules that control how to determine which regions are inside or outside the path.

The permissions attribute is a set of access permissions. This file attribute view provides access to the nine permission bits defined by the PosixFilePermission class. These nine permission bits determine the read, write, and execute access for the file owner, group, and others (others meaning identities other than the owner and members of the group). Some operating systems and file systems may provide additional permission bits but access to these other bits is not defined by this class in this release.

The permissions attribute is a set of access permissions. This file attribute view provides access to the nine permission defined by the PosixFilePermission class. These nine permission bits determine the read, write, and execute access for the file owner, group, and others (others meaning identities other than the owner and members of the group). Some operating systems and file systems may provide additional permission bits but access to these other bits is not defined by this class in this release.

The permissions attribute is a set of access permissions. This file attribute view provides access to the nine permission defined by the PosixFilePermission class. These nine permission bits determine the read, write, and execute access for the file owner, group, and others (others meaning identities other than the owner and members of the group). Some operating systems and file systems may provide additional permission bits but access to these other bits is not defined by this class in this release.
trans-unit.target: El atributo de permissions es un conjunto de permisos de acceso. Esta vista de atributo de archivo proporciona acceso a los nueve permisos definidos por la clase PosixFilePermission . Estos nueve bits de permiso determinan el acceso de lectura , escritura y ejecución para el propietario del archivo, el grupo y otros (otros significan identidades distintas del propietario y los miembros del grupo). Algunos sistemas operativos y sistemas de archivos pueden proporcionar bits de permiso adicionales, pero el acceso a estos otros bits no está definido por esta clase en esta versión.

trans-unit.source: The PosixFileAttributeView interface extends BasicFileAttributeView by defining methods to access the file attributes commonly used by file systems and operating systems that implement the Portable Operating System Interface (POSIX) family of standards.
trans-unit.target: La interfaz PosixFileAttributeView extiende BasicFileAttributeView mediante la definición de métodos para acceder a los atributos de archivo comúnmente utilizados por los sistemas de archivos y los sistemas operativos que implementan la familia de estándares de la Interfaz de sistema operativo portátil (POSIX).

trans-unit.source: The readAttributes method is used to read the file's attributes. The file owner is represented by a UserPrincipal that is the identity of the file owner for the purposes of access control. The group-owner, represented by a GroupPrincipal, is the identity of the group owner, where a group is an identity created for administrative purposes so as to determine the access rights for the members of the group.
trans-unit.target: El método readAttributes se utiliza para leer los atributos del archivo. El owner archivo está representado por un UserPrincipal que es la identidad del propietario del archivo para fines de control de acceso. El group-owner , representado por un GroupPrincipal , es la identidad del propietario del grupo, donde un grupo es una identidad creada con fines administrativos para determinar los derechos de acceso de los miembros del grupo.

trans-unit.source: The PosixFilePermissions class defines methods for manipulating set of permissions.
trans-unit.target: La clase PosixFilePermissions define métodos para manipular un conjunto de permisos.

trans-unit.source: The Process instances created by ProcessBuilder can be queried for a ProcessHandle that provides information about the Process. ProcessHandle references should not be freely distributed.
The standard output of all processes except the last process are
The ProcessBuilder.start() and Runtime.exec methods create a native process and return an instance of a subclass of Process that can be used to control the process and obtain information about it.
trans-unit.target: Los ProcessBuilder.start() y Runtime.exec crean un proceso nativo y devuelven una instancia de una subclase de Process que se puede utilizar para controlar el proceso y obtener información sobre él.

trans-unit.source: The ProcessBuilder.start() and Runtime.exec methods create a native process and return an instance of a subclass of Process that can be used to control the process and obtain information about it. The class Process provides methods for performing input from the process, performing output to the process, waiting for the process to complete, checking the exit status of the process, and destroying (killing) the process.
trans-unit.target: Los ProcessBuilder.start() y Runtime.exec crean un proceso nativo y devuelven una instancia de una subclase de Process que se puede utilizar para controlar el proceso y obtener información sobre él. La clase Process proporciona métodos para realizar la entrada del proceso, realizar la salida al proceso, esperar a que se complete el proceso, verificar el estado de salida del proceso y destruir (matar) el proceso.

trans-unit.source: The load(Reader)/store(Writer, String) methods load and store properties from and to a character based stream in a simple line-oriented format specified below. The load(InputStream)/store(OutputStream, String) methods work the same way as the load(Reader)/store(Writer, String) pair, except the input/output stream is encoded in ISO 8859-1 character encoding. Characters that cannot be directly represented in this encoding can be written using Unicode escapes as defined in section 3.3 of
trans-unit.target: Los métodos load(Reader) / store(Writer, String) cargan y almacenan propiedades desde y hacia una secuencia basada en caracteres en un formato simple orientado a líneas que se especifica a continuación. Los métodos load(InputStream) / store(OutputStream, String) funcionan de la misma manera que el par load (Reader) / store (Writer, String), excepto que el flujo de entrada / salida está codificado en la codificación de caracteres ISO 8859-1. Los caracteres que no se pueden representar directamente en esta codificación se pueden escribir utilizando escapes Unicode como se define en la sección 3.3 de

trans-unit.source: The loadFromXML(InputStream) and storeToXML(OutputStream, String, String) methods load and store properties in a simple XML format. By default the UTF-8 character encoding is used, however a specific encoding may be specified if required. Implementations are required to support UTF-8 and UTF-16 and may support other encodings. An XML properties document has the following DOCTYPE declaration:
trans-unit.target: Los loadFromXML(InputStream) y storeToXML(OutputStream, String, String) cargan y almacenan propiedades en un formato XML simple. De forma predeterminada, se utiliza la codificación de caracteres UTF-8, sin embargo, se puede especificar una codificación específica si es necesario. Se requieren implementaciones para admitir UTF-8 y UTF-16 y pueden admitir otras codificaciones. Un documento de propiedades XML tiene la siguiente declaración DOCTYPE:

trans-unit.source: The Proxy.isProxyClass method will return true if it is passed a proxy class-- a class returned by Proxy.getProxyClass or the class of an object returned by Proxy.newProxyInstance-- and false otherwise.
trans-unit.target: El método Proxy.isProxyClass devolverá verdadero si se le pasa una clase de proxy, una clase devuelta por Proxy.getProxyClass o la clase de un objeto devuelto por Proxy.newProxyInstance , y falso en caso contrario.

trans-unit.source: The element() and peek() methods return, but do not remove, the head of the queue.
trans-unit.target: Los métodos element() y peek() devuelven, pero no eliminan, el encabezado de la cola.

trans-unit.source: The offer method inserts an element if possible, otherwise returning false. This differs from the Collection.add method, which can fail to add an element only by throwing an unchecked exception. The offer method is designed for use when failure is a normal, rather than exceptional occurrence, for example, in fixed-capacity (or "bounded") queues.
trans-unit.target: El método de offer inserta un elemento si es posible; de ​​lo contrario, devuelve false . Esto difiere del método Collection.add , que puede fallar al agregar un elemento solo lanzando una excepción sin marcar. El método de offer está diseñado para usarse cuando la falla es una ocurrencia normal, más que excepcional, por ejemplo, en colas de capacidad fija (o "limitadas").

trans-unit.source: The remove() and poll() methods remove and return the head of the queue. Exactly which element is removed from the queue is a function of the queue's ordering policy, which differs from implementation to implementation. The remove() and poll() methods differ only in their behavior when the queue is empty: the remove() method throws an exception, while the poll() method returns null.
trans-unit.target: Los métodos remove() y poll() eliminan y devuelven el encabezado de la cola. Exactamente qué elemento se elimina de la cola es una función de la política de ordenación de la cola, que difiere de una implementación a otra. Los métodos remove() y poll() difieren solo en su comportamiento cuando la cola está vacía: el método remove() arroja una excepción, mientras que el método poll() devuelve null .

trans-unit.source: The ReadableByteChannel interface specifies a read method that reads bytes from the channel into a buffer; similarly, the WritableByteChannel interface specifies a write method that writes bytes from a buffer to the channel. The ByteChannel interface unifies these two interfaces for the common case of channels that can both read and write bytes. The SeekableByteChannel interface extends the ByteChannel interface with methods to query and modify the channel's current position, and its size.

The ReadableByteChannel interface specifies a read method that reads bytes from the channel into a buffer; similarly, the WritableByteChannel interface specifies a write method that writes bytes from a buffer to the channel. The ByteChannel interface unifies these two interfaces for the common case of channels that can both read and write bytes. The SeekableByteChannel interface extends the ByteChannel interface with methods to query and modify the channel's current position, and its size.
trans-unit.target: La interfaz ReadableByteChannel especifica un método de read que lee bytes del canal en un búfer; de manera similar, la interfaz WritableByteChannel especifica un método de write que escribe bytes desde un búfer en el canal. La interfaz ByteChannel unifica estas dos interfaces para el caso común de canales que pueden leer y escribir bytes. La interfaz SeekableByteChannel extiende la interfaz ByteChannel con métodos para query y modify la posición actual del canal y su size .

trans-unit.source: The ReadWriteLock interface similarly defines locks that may be shared among readers but are exclusive to writers. Only a single implementation, ReentrantReadWriteLock, is provided, since it covers most standard usage contexts. But programmers may create their own implementations to cover nonstandard requirements.
trans-unit.target: La interfaz ReadWriteLock define de manera similar los bloqueos que se pueden compartir entre los lectores pero que son exclusivos de los escritores. Se proporciona una única implementación, ReentrantReadWriteLock , ya que cubre la mayoría de los contextos de uso estándar. Pero los programadores pueden crear sus propias implementaciones para cubrir requisitos no estándar.

trans-unit.source: The ResolverStyle is an enum that offers three different approaches, strict, smart and lenient. The smart option is the default. It can be set using withResolverStyle(ResolverStyle).
The ResolverStyle is an enum that offers three different approaches, strict, smart and lenient. The smart option is the default. It can be set using withResolverStyle(ResolverStyle).
trans-unit.target: El ResolverStyle es una enumeración que ofrece tres enfoques diferentes: estricto, inteligente e indulgente. La opción inteligente es la predeterminada. Se puede configurar usando withResolverStyle(ResolverStyle) .

trans-unit.source: The resolver style has no effect on instant parsing. The end-of-day time of '24:00' is handled as midnight at the start of the following day. The leap-second time of '23:59:59' is handled to some degree, see DateTimeFormatter.parsedLeapSecond() for full details.

The resolver style has no effect on instant parsing. The end-of-day time of '24:00' is handled as midnight at the start of the following day. The leap-second time of '23:59:59' is handled to some degree, see DateTimeFormatter.parsedLeapSecond() for full details.
trans-unit.target: El estilo de resolución no tiene ningún efecto sobre el análisis instantáneo. La hora del final del día de '24: 00 'se maneja como la medianoche al comienzo del día siguiente. El tiempo del segundo intercalar de '23: 59: 59 'se maneja hasta cierto punto, consulte DateTimeFormatter.parsedLeapSecond() para obtener detalles completos.

trans-unit.source: The resolver style has no effect on instant parsing. The end-of-day time of '24:00' is handled as midnight at the start of the following day. The leap-second time of '23:59:60' is handled to some degree, see DateTimeFormatter.parsedLeapSecond() for full details.

The resolver style has no effect on instant parsing. The end-of-day time of '24:00' is handled as midnight at the start of the following day. The leap-second time of '23:59:60' is handled to some degree, see DateTimeFormatter.parsedLeapSecond() for full details.
trans-unit.target: El estilo de resolución no tiene ningún efecto sobre el análisis instantáneo. La hora del final del día de '24: 00 'se maneja como la medianoche al comienzo del día siguiente. El tiempo del segundo intercalar de '23: 59: 60 'se maneja hasta cierto punto, consulte DateTimeFormatter.parsedLeapSecond() para obtener detalles completos.

trans-unit.source: The ResourceBundle.Control class provides information necessary to perform the bundle loading process by the getBundle factory methods that take a ResourceBundle.Control instance. You can implement your own subclass in order to enable non-standard resource bundle formats, change the search strategy, or define caching parameters. Refer to the descriptions of the class and the getBundle factory method for details.

The ResourceBundle.Control class provides information necessary to perform the bundle loading process by the getBundle factory methods that take a ResourceBundle.Control instance. You can implement your own subclass in order to enable non-standard resource bundle formats, change the search strategy, or define caching parameters. Refer to the descriptions of the class and the getBundle factory method for details.
trans-unit.target: La clase ResourceBundle.Control proporciona la información necesaria para realizar el proceso de carga del paquete mediante los métodos de fábrica getBundle que toman una instancia ResourceBundle.Control . Puede implementar su propia subclase para habilitar formatos de paquetes de recursos no estándar, cambiar la estrategia de búsqueda o definir parámetros de almacenamiento en caché. Consulte las descripciones de la clase y el método de fábrica getBundle para obtener más detalles.

trans-unit.source: The control.getCandidateLocales method is called with the target locale to get a list of candidate Locales for which resource bundles are searched.
The control.getCandidateLocales method is called with the target locale to get a list of candidate Locales for which resource bundles are searched.
trans-unit.target: El control.getCandidateLocales método se llama a la configuración regional de destino para obtener una lista de candidatos Locale s para los que se buscan paquetes de recursos.

trans-unit.source: The control.getFallbackLocale method is called to get a fallback locale (alternative to the current target locale) to try further finding a resource bundle. If the method returns a non-null locale, it becomes the next target locale and the loading process starts over from Step 3. Otherwise, if a base bundle was found and put on hold in a previous Step 5, it is returned to the caller now. Otherwise, a MissingResourceException is thrown.

The control.getFallbackLocale method is called to get a fallback locale (alternative to the current target locale) to try further finding a resource bundle. If the method returns a non-null locale, it becomes the next target locale and the loading process starts over from Step 3. Otherwise, if a base bundle was found and put on hold in a previous Step 5, it is returned to the caller now. Otherwise, a MissingResourceException is thrown.
trans-unit.target: Se llama al método control.getFallbackLocale para obtener una configuración regional alternativa (alternativa a la configuración regional de destino actual) para intentar encontrar un paquete de recursos. Si el método devuelve una configuración regional no nula, se convierte en la siguiente configuración regional de destino y el proceso de carga comienza desde el Paso 3. De lo contrario, si se encontró un paquete base y se puso en espera en un Paso 5 anterior, se devuelve al llamador ahora. De lo contrario, se lanza una MissingResourceException.

trans-unit.source: The control.getFormats method is called to get resource bundle formats to produce bundle or resource names. The strings "java.class" and "java.properties" designate class-based and property-based resource bundles, respectively. Other strings starting with "java." are reserved for future extensions and must not be used for application-defined formats. Other strings designate application-defined formats.

The control.getFormats method is called to get resource bundle formats to produce bundle or resource names. The strings "java.class" and "java.properties" designate class-based and property-based resource bundles, respectively. Other strings starting with "java." are reserved for future extensions and must not be used for application-defined formats. Other strings designate application-defined formats.
trans-unit.target: Se llama al método control.getFormats para obtener formatos de paquetes de recursos para producir nombres de recursos o paquetes. Las cadenas "java.class" y "java.properties" designan paquetes de recursos basados ​​en clases y basados ​​en propiedades , respectivamente. Otras cadenas que comienzan con "java." están reservados para futuras extensiones y no deben usarse para formatos definidos por la aplicación. Otras cadenas designan formatos definidos por la aplicación.

trans-unit.source: The control.newBundle method is called to instantiate a ResourceBundle for the base bundle name, a candidate locale, and a format. (Refer to the note on the cache lookup below.) This step is iterated over all combinations of the candidate locales and formats until the newBundle method returns a ResourceBundle instance or the iteration has used up all the combinations. For example, if the candidate locales are Locale("de", "DE"), Locale("de") and Locale("") and the formats are "java.class" and "java.properties", then the following is the sequence of locale-format combinations to be used to call control.newBundle.

This step is iterated over all combinations of the candidate locales and formats until the newBundle method returns a ResourceBundle instance or the iteration has used up all the combinations. For example, if the candidate locales are Locale("de", "DE"), Locale("de") and Locale("") and the formats are "java.class" and "java.properties", then the following is the sequence of locale-format combinations to be used to call control.newBundle.
trans-unit.target: Se llama al método control.newBundle para crear una instancia de ResourceBundle para el nombre del paquete base, una configuración regional candidata y un formato. (Consulte la nota sobre la búsqueda de caché a continuación). Este paso se repite en todas las combinaciones de las configuraciones regionales y formatos candidatos hasta que el método newBundle devuelve una instancia de ResourceBundle o la iteración ha agotado todas las combinaciones. Por ejemplo, si las configuraciones Locale("de", "DE") candidatas son Locale ("de", "DE") , Locale("de") y Locale("") y los formatos son "java.class" y "java.properties" ,entonces la siguiente es la secuencia de combinaciones de formato local que se utilizará para llamar control.newBundle .

trans-unit.source: The Sasl class includes several well-known property names (For example, Sasl.QOP). A SASL provider can support other properties which are specific to the vendor and/or a mechanism.
The SAXResult class allows the setting of a ContentHandler to be the receiver of SAX2 events from the transformation.
The SAXSource class allows the setting of an XMLReader to be used for pulling parse events, and an InputSource that may be used to specify the SAX source.
The SAXTransformerFactory extends TransformerFactory to provide factory methods for creating TemplatesHandler, TransformerHandler, and XMLReader instances.

The SAXTransformerFactory.newXMLFilter(javax.xml.transform.Source) method allows the creation of a XMLFilter, which encapsulates the SAX2 notion of a "pull" transformation. The resulting XMLFilters can be chained together so that a series of transformations can happen with one's output becoming another's input.

The findInLine(java.lang.String), findWithinHorizon(java.lang.String, int), and skip(java.util.regex.Pattern) methods operate independently of the delimiter pattern. These methods will attempt to match the specified pattern with no regard to delimiters in the input and thus can be used in special circumstances where delimiters are not relevant. These methods may block waiting for more input.
trans-unit.target: Los findInLine(java.lang.String) , findWithinHorizon(java.lang.String, int) y skip(java.util.regex.Pattern) operan independientemente del patrón delimitador. Estos métodos intentarán hacer coincidir el patrón especificado sin tener en cuenta los delimitadores en la entrada y, por lo tanto, se pueden usar en circunstancias especiales donde los delimitadores no son relevantes. Estos métodos pueden bloquear la espera de más entradas.

trans-unit.source: The next() and hasNext() methods and their primitive-type companion methods (such as nextInt() and hasNextInt()) first skip any input that matches the delimiter pattern, and then attempt to return the next token. Both hasNext and next methods may block waiting for further input. Whether a hasNext method blocks has no connection to whether or not its associated next method will block.
trans-unit.target: Los métodos next() y hasNext() y sus métodos complementarios de tipo primitivo (como nextInt() y hasNextInt() ) primero omiten cualquier entrada que coincida con el patrón delimitador y luego intentan devolver el siguiente token. Ambos métodos hasNext y next pueden bloquear la espera de más entradas. Si un método hasNext bloquea no tiene conexión con si su next método asociado se bloqueará o no .

trans-unit.source: The ScatteringByteChannel and GatheringByteChannel interfaces extend the ReadableByteChannel and WritableByteChannel interfaces, respectively, adding read and write methods that take a sequence of buffers rather than a single buffer.

The ScatteringByteChannel and GatheringByteChannel interfaces extend the ReadableByteChannel and WritableByteChannel interfaces, respectively, adding read and write methods that take a sequence of buffers rather than a single buffer.
trans-unit.target: Las interfaces ScatteringByteChannel y GatheringByteChannel extienden las interfaces ReadableByteChannel y WritableByteChannel , respectivamente, agregando métodos de read y write que toman una secuencia de búferes en lugar de un solo búfer.

trans-unit.source: The SchemaFactory class is not thread-safe. In other words, it is the application's responsibility to ensure that at most one thread is using a SchemaFactory object at any given moment. Implementations are encouraged to mark methods as synchronized to protect themselves from broken clients.

The position and truncate methods which do not otherwise have a value to return are specified to return the channel upon which they are invoked. This allows method invocations to be chained. Implementations of this interface should specialize the return type so that method invocations on the implementation class can be chained.
trans-unit.target: Los métodos position y truncate que de otro modo no tienen un valor para devolver se especifican para devolver el canal en el que se invocan. Esto permite encadenar las invocaciones de métodos. Las implementaciones de esta interfaz deben especializar el tipo de retorno para que las invocaciones de métodos en la clase de implementación se puedan encadenar.

trans-unit.source: The close method synchronizes on the selector and all three key sets in the same order as in a selection operation.
trans-unit.target: El método de close se sincroniza en el selector y los tres conjuntos de teclas en el mismo orden que en una operación de selección.

trans-unit.source: The Snippet.Kind for the snippet.
The Snippet.Kind for the snippet. Indicates the subclass of Snippet.
The Snippet.Kind that corresponds to this SubKind.
The name of each socket option defined by this class is its field name.
The name of each socket option defined by this class is its field name.
trans-unit.target: El name de cada opción de socket definida por esta clase es su nombre de campo.

trans-unit.source: The stack walking options of a StackWalker determines the information of StackFrame objects to be returned. The StandardCharsets class defines constants for each of the standard charsets.

trans-unit.source: The SYNC and DSYNC options are used when opening a file to require that updates to the file are written synchronously to the underlying storage device. In the case of the default provider, and the file resides on a local storage device, and the seekable channel is connected to a file that was opened with one of these options, then an invocation of the write method is only guaranteed to return when all changes made to the file by that invocation have been written to the device. These options are useful for ensuring that critical information is not lost in the event of a system crash. If the file does not reside on a local device then no such guarantee is made. Whether this guarantee is possible with other provider implementations is provider specific.

The SYNC and DSYNC options are used when opening a file to require that updates to the file are written synchronously to the underlying storage device. In the case of the default provider, and the file resides on a local storage device, and the seekable channel is connected to a file that was opened with one of these options, then an invocation of the write method is only guaranteed to return when all changes made to the file by that invocation have been written to the device. These options are useful for ensuring that critical information is not lost in the event of a system crash. If the file does not reside on a local device then no such guarantee is made. Whether this guarantee is possible with other provider implementations is provider specific.
trans-unit.target: Las opciones SYNC y DSYNC se utilizan al abrir un archivo para requerir que las actualizaciones del archivo se escriban de forma sincrónica en el dispositivo de almacenamiento subyacente. En el caso del proveedor predeterminado, y el archivo reside en un dispositivo de almacenamiento local, y el canal de seekable está conectado a un archivo que se abrió con una de estas opciones, solo se garantiza que una invocación del método de write regrese cuando todos los cambios realizados en el archivo por esa invocación se han escrito en el dispositivo. Estas opciones son útiles para garantizar que la información crítica no se pierda en caso de una falla del sistema. Si el archivo no reside en un dispositivo local, no se ofrece tal garantía. Si esta garantía es posible con otro provider las implementaciones son específicas del proveedor.

trans-unit.source: The StAXResult class encapsulates a XMLStreamWriter or XMLEventWriter and can be used as an output where a Result object is accepted.
The StAXSource class encapsulates a XMLStreamReader or XMLEventReader and can be used as an input where a Source object is accepted.
The StreamResult class provides methods for specifying OutputStream, Writer, or an output system ID, as the output of the transformation result.

The StreamSource class provides methods for specifying InputStream input, Reader input, and URL input in the form of strings. Even if an input stream or reader is specified as the source, StreamSource.setSystemId(java.lang.String) should still be called, so that the transformer can know from where it should resolve relative URIs. The public identifier is always optional: if the application writer includes one, it will be provided as part of the SourceLocator information.
The System.exit method is the conventional and convenient means of invoking this method.

The TemplatesHandler interface allows the creation of Templates objects from SAX2 parse events. Once the ContentHandler events are complete, the Templates object may be obtained from TemplatesHandler.getTemplates(). Note that TemplatesHandler.setSystemId(java.lang.String) should normally be called in order to establish a base system ID from which relative URLs may be resolved.

trans-unit.source: The isThreadContentionMonitoringSupported() method can be used to determine if a Java virtual machine supports thread contention monitoring. The thread contention monitoring is disabled by default. The setThreadContentionMonitoringEnabled(boolean) method can be used to enable thread contention monitoring.
trans-unit.target: El método isThreadContentionMonitoringSupported() se puede utilizar para determinar si una máquina virtual Java admite la supervisión de la contención de subprocesos. La supervisión de la contención de subprocesos está desactivada de forma predeterminada. El setThreadContentionMonitoringEnabled(boolean) se puede utilizar para habilitar la supervisión de la contención de subprocesos.

trans-unit.source: The isThreadCpuTimeSupported() method can be used to determine if a Java virtual machine supports measuring of the CPU time for any thread. The isCurrentThreadCpuTimeSupported() method can be used to determine if a Java virtual machine supports measuring of the CPU time for the current thread. A Java virtual machine implementation that supports CPU time measurement for any thread will also support that for the current thread.
trans-unit.target: El método isThreadCpuTimeSupported() se puede utilizar para determinar si una máquina virtual Java admite la medición del tiempo de CPU para cualquier subproceso. El método isCurrentThreadCpuTimeSupported() se puede utilizar para determinar si una máquina virtual Java admite la medición del tiempo de CPU para el subproceso actual. Una implementación de máquina virtual Java que admita la medición del tiempo de CPU para cualquier subproceso también lo admitirá para el subproceso actual.

trans-unit.source: The fillInStackTrace() method is called to initialize the stack trace data in the newly created throwable.
trans-unit.target: Se llama al método fillInStackTrace() para inicializar los datos de seguimiento de la pila en el elemento arrojable recién creado.

trans-unit.source: The TimeUnit class provides multiple granularities (including nanoseconds) for specifying and controlling time-out based operations. Most classes in the package contain operations based on time-outs in addition to indefinite waits. In all cases that time-outs are used, the time-out specifies the minimum time that the method should wait before indicating that it timed-out. Implementations make a "best effort" to detect time-outs as soon as possible after they occur. However, an indefinite amount of time may elapse between a time-out being detected and a thread actually executing again after that time-out. All methods that accept timeout parameters treat values less than or equal to zero to mean not to wait at all. To wait "forever", you can use a value of Long.MAX_VALUE.
trans-unit.target: La clase TimeUnit proporciona múltiples granularidades (incluidos nanosegundos) para especificar y controlar operaciones basadas en tiempos de espera. La mayoría de las clases del paquete contienen operaciones basadas en tiempos de espera además de esperas indefinidas. En todos los casos en que se utilizan tiempos de espera, el tiempo de espera especifica el tiempo mínimo que debe esperar el método antes de indicar que se agotó el tiempo de espera. Las implementaciones hacen el "mejor esfuerzo" para detectar tiempos de espera lo antes posible después de que ocurren. Sin embargo, puede transcurrir una cantidad de tiempo indefinida entre la detección de un tiempo de espera y la ejecución de un hilo después de ese tiempo de espera. Todos los métodos que aceptan parámetros de tiempo de espera tratan los valores menores o iguales a cero para significar que no deben esperar en absoluto. Para esperar "para siempre", puede utilizar un valor de Long.MAX_VALUE .

trans-unit.source: The TransformerHandler interface allows a transformation to be created from SAX2 parse events, which is a "push" model rather than the "pull" model that normally occurs for a transformation. Normal parse events are received through the ContentHandler interface, lexical events such as startCDATA and endCDATA are received through the LexicalHandler interface, and events that signal the start or end of disabling output escaping are received via ContentHandler.processingInstruction(java.lang.String, java.lang.String), with the target parameter being Result.PI_DISABLE_OUTPUT_ESCAPING and Result.PI_ENABLE_OUTPUT_ESCAPING. If parameters, output properties, or other features need to be set on the Transformer handler, a Transformer reference will need to be obtained from TransformerHandler.getTransformer(), and the methods invoked from that reference.

The width is the minimum number of characters to be written to the output. This includes any signs, digits, grouping separators, decimal separators, exponential symbol, radix indicator, parentheses, and strings representing infinity and NaN as applicable. If the length of the converted value is less than the width then the output will be padded by spaces ('\u0020') until the total number of characters equals width. The padding is on the left by default. If the '-' flag is given then the padding will be on the right. If width is not specified then there is no minimum.

The all-at-once pattern: Get the doc from the current multidoc, and save the doc in a list. Get the next multidoc from the current multidoc, and repeat until there are no more. Then iterate over the list of saved docs. Get the print data representation object from the current doc. Get all the print data from the print data representation object. Go to the next doc in the list, and repeat until there are no more.
trans-unit.target: El patrón todo a la vez : obtenga el documento del multidoc actual y guarde el documento en una lista. Obtenga el siguiente multidoc del multidoc actual y repita hasta que no haya más. Luego, repita la lista de documentos guardados. Obtenga el objeto de representación de datos de impresión del documento actual. Obtenga todos los datos de impresión del objeto de representación de datos de impresión. Vaya al siguiente documento de la lista y repita hasta que no haya más.

trans-unit.source: The interleaved pattern: Get the doc from the current multidoc. Get the print data representation object from the current doc. Get all the print data from the print data representation object. Get the next multidoc from the current multidoc, and repeat until there are no more. (The code example above uses the interleaved pattern.)
trans-unit.target: El patrón intercalado : obtenga el documento del multidoc actual. Obtenga el objeto de representación de datos de impresión del documento actual. Obtenga todos los datos de impresión del objeto de representación de datos de impresión. Obtenga el siguiente multidoc del multidoc actual y repita hasta que no haya más. (El ejemplo de código anterior usa el patrón intercalado).

trans-unit.source: The javax.management.builder.initial system property is consulted every time a new MBeanServer needs to be created, and the class pointed to by that property is loaded. If that class is different from that of the current MBeanServerBuilder, then a new MBeanServerBuilder is created. Otherwise, the MBeanServerFactory may create a new MBeanServerBuilder or reuse the current one.
trans-unit.target: La propiedad del sistema javax.management.builder.initial se consulta cada vez que se necesita crear un nuevo MBeanServer y se carga la clase a la que apunta esa propiedad. Si esa clase es diferente de la del MBeanServerBuilder actual, se crea un nuevo MBeanServerBuilder. De lo contrario, MBeanServerFactory puede crear un nuevo MBeanServerBuilder o reutilizar el actual.

trans-unit.source: The TooManyListenersException Exception is used as part of the Java Event model to annotate and implement a unicast special case of a multicast Event Source.
trans-unit.target: La excepción TooManyListenersException se utiliza como parte del modelo de eventos de Java para anotar e implementar un caso especial de unidifusión de un origen de evento de multidifusión.

trans-unit.source: The java.security.acl package provides the interfaces to the ACL and related data structures (ACL entries, groups, permissions, etc.).

The java.security.acl.Acl interface extends the java.security.acl.Owner interface. The Owner interface is used to maintain a list of owners for each ACL. Only owners are allowed to modify an ACL. For example, only an owner can call the ACL's addEntry method to add a new ACL entry to the ACL.

The "rwd" mode can be used to reduce the number of I/O operations performed. Using "rwd" only requires updates to the file's content to be written to storage; using "rws" requires updates to both the file's content and its metadata to be written, which generally requires at least one more low-level I/O operation.
trans-unit.target: El modo "rwd" se puede utilizar para reducir el número de operaciones de E / S realizadas. El uso de "rwd" solo requiere que las actualizaciones del contenido del archivo se escriban en el almacenamiento; El uso de "rws" requiere que se escriban actualizaciones tanto del contenido del archivo como de sus metadatos, lo que generalmente requiere al menos una operación más de E / S de bajo nivel.

trans-unit.source: The "rws" and "rwd" modes work much like the force(boolean) method of the FileChannel class, passing arguments of true and false, respectively, except that they always apply to every I/O operation and are therefore often more efficient. If the file resides on a local storage device then when an invocation of a method of this class returns it is guaranteed that all changes made to the file by that invocation will have been written to that device. This is useful for ensuring that critical information is not lost in the event of a system crash. If the file does not reside on a local device then no such guarantee is made.

The "rws" and "rwd" modes work much like the force(boolean) method of the FileChannel class, passing arguments of true and false, respectively, except that they always apply to every I/O operation and are therefore often more efficient. If the file resides on a local storage device then when an invocation of a method of this class returns it is guaranteed that all changes made to the file by that invocation will have been written to that device. This is useful for ensuring that critical information is not lost in the event of a system crash. If the file does not reside on a local device then no such guarantee is made.
trans-unit.target: Los "rws" y "rwd" funcionan de manera muy similar al método force(boolean) de la clase FileChannel , pasando argumentos de true y false , respectivamente, excepto que siempre se aplican a todas las operaciones de E / S y, por lo tanto, a menudo son más eficientes. Si el archivo reside en un dispositivo de almacenamiento local, cuando se devuelve una invocación de un método de esta clase, se garantiza que todos los cambios realizados en el archivo mediante esa invocación se habrán escrito en ese dispositivo. Esto es útil para garantizar que la información crítica no se pierda en caso de una falla del sistema. Si el archivo no reside en un dispositivo local, no se ofrece tal garantía.

trans-unit.source: The < relation does not provide a total order on all double values: -0.0d == 0.0d is true and a Double.NaN value compares neither less than, greater than, nor equal to any value, even itself. This method uses the total order imposed by the method Double.compareTo(java.lang.Double): -0.0d is treated as less than value 0.0d and Double.NaN is considered greater than any other value and all Double.NaN values are considered equal.

The < relation does not provide a total order on all double values: -0.0d == 0.0d is true and a Double.NaN value compares neither less than, greater than, nor equal to any value, even itself. This method uses the total order imposed by the method Double.compareTo(java.lang.Double): -0.0d is treated as less than value 0.0d and Double.NaN is considered greater than any other value and all Double.NaN values are considered equal.
trans-unit.target: La relación < no proporciona un orden total en todos los valores dobles: -0.0d == 0.0d es true y un valor Double.NaN no compara ni menor que, mayor que ni igual a ningún valor, incluso a sí mismo. Este método utiliza el orden total impuesto por el método Double.compareTo(java.lang.Double) : -0.0d se trata como menor que el valor 0.0d y Double.NaN se considera mayor que cualquier otro valor y todos los valores Double.NaN son considerado igual.

trans-unit.source: The < relation does not provide a total order on all float values: -0.0f == 0.0f is true and a Float.NaN value compares neither less than, greater than, nor equal to any value, even itself. This method uses the total order imposed by the method Float.compareTo(java.lang.Float): -0.0f is treated as less than value 0.0f and Float.NaN is considered greater than any other value and all Float.NaN values are considered equal.

The < relation does not provide a total order on all float values: -0.0f == 0.0f is true and a Float.NaN value compares neither less than, greater than, nor equal to any value, even itself. This method uses the total order imposed by the method Float.compareTo(java.lang.Float): -0.0f is treated as less than value 0.0f and Float.NaN is considered greater than any other value and all Float.NaN values are considered equal.
trans-unit.target: La relación < no proporciona un orden total en todos los valores flotantes: -0.0f == 0.0f es true y un valor Float.NaN no compara ni menor, mayor ni igual a ningún valor, incluso a sí mismo. Este método utiliza el orden total impuesto por el método Float.compareTo(java.lang.Float) : -0.0f se trata como menos que el valor 0.0f y Float.NaN se considera mayor que cualquier otro valor y todos los valores Float.NaN son considerado igual.

trans-unit.source: The ** characters matches zero or more characters crossing directory boundaries.
trans-unit.target: Los ** caracteres coinciden con cero o más characters cruzan los límites del directorio.

trans-unit.source: The * character matches zero or more characters of a name component without crossing directory boundaries.
The * character matches zero or more characters of a name component without crossing directory boundaries.
trans-unit.target: El carácter * coincide con cero o más characters de un componente de name sin cruzar los límites del directorio.

trans-unit.source: The AudioSystem class includes methods for determining the format of an audio file, obtaining an audio input stream from an audio file, and writing an audio file from an audio input stream.
trans-unit.target: La clase AudioSystem incluye métodos para determinar el formato de un archivo de audio, obtener una secuencia de entrada de audio de un archivo de audio y escribir un archivo de audio a partir de una secuencia de entrada de audio.

trans-unit.source: The System.exit method is the conventional and convenient means of invoking this method.
trans-unit.target: El método System.exit es el medio convencional y conveniente de invocar este método.

trans-unit.source: The ArbitraryText is any additional text that the connector server adds when creating the client id. At a minimum, it must be enough to distinguish this connection ID from the ID of any other connection currently opened by this connector server.
trans-unit.target: El ArbitraryText es cualquier texto adicional que el servidor del conector agrega al crear la identificación del cliente. Como mínimo, debe ser suficiente distinguir este ID de conexión del ID de cualquier otra conexión abierta actualmente por este servidor de conector.

trans-unit.source: The ClientAddress is the address and port of the connecting client, if these can be determined, otherwise nothing. The HostAddress is the Internet address of the host that the client is connecting from, in numeric or DNS form. Numeric IPv6 addresses are enclosed in square brackets []. The HostPort is the decimal port number that the client is connecting from.
trans-unit.target: El ClientAddress es la dirección y el puerto del cliente que se conecta, si éstos se pueden determinar, de lo contrario nada. El HostAddress es la dirección de Internet del host que el cliente se conecta desde, en forma numérica o DNS. Las direcciones IPv6 numéricas se incluyen entre corchetes [] . El HostPort es el número de puerto decimal que el cliente se conecta a.

trans-unit.source: The ClientId is the identity of the client entity, typically a string returned by JMXPrincipal.getName(). This string must not contain spaces.
The ClientId is the identity of the client entity, typically a string returned by JMXPrincipal.getName(). This string must not contain spaces.
trans-unit.target: El ClientId es la identidad de la entidad cliente, normalmente una cadena devuelta por JMXPrincipal.getName() . Esta cadena no debe contener espacios.

trans-unit.source: The Protocol is a protocol that would be recognized by JMXConnectorFactory.
trans-unit.target: El Protocol o es un protocolo que sería reconocido por JMXConnectorFactory .

trans-unit.source: The host and port can be omitted. The port cannot be supplied without a host.
trans-unit.target: El host y el port se pueden omitir. El port no se puede suministrar sin un host .

trans-unit.source: The host in a user-provided serviceURL is optional. If present, it is copied into the generated JMXServiceURL but otherwise ignored. If absent, the generated JXMServiceURL will have the local host name.
trans-unit.target: El host en un serviceURL proporcionado por el usuario es opcional. Si está presente, se copia en la JMXServiceURL generada, pero se ignora. Si está ausente, la JXMServiceURL generada tendrá el nombre de host local.

trans-unit.source: The host is a host name, an IPv4 numeric host address, or an IPv6 numeric address enclosed in square brackets.
trans-unit.target: El host es un nombre de host, una dirección de host numérica IPv4 o una dirección numérica IPv6 entre corchetes.

trans-unit.source: The host part of the returned string is the value returned by getHost(). If that value specifies a numeric IPv6 address, it is surrounded by square brackets [].
The host part of the returned string is the value returned by getHost(). If that value specifies a numeric IPv6 address, it is surrounded by square brackets [].
trans-unit.target: La parte del host de la cadena devuelta es el valor devuelto por getHost() . Si ese valor especifica una dirección IPv6 numérica, está entre corchetes [] .

trans-unit.source: The port in a user-provided serviceURL is also optional. If present, it is also copied into the generated JMXServiceURL; otherwise, the generated JMXServiceURL has no port. For an serviceURL using the rmi protocol, the port, if present, indicates what port the generated remote object should be exported on. It has no other effect.
trans-unit.target: El port en una serviceURL proporcionada por el usuario también es opcional. Si está presente, también se copia en el JMXServiceURL generado ; de lo contrario, el JMXServiceURL generado no tiene puerto. Para un serviceURL que usa el protocolo rmi , el port , si está presente, indica en qué puerto se debe exportar el objeto remoto generado. No tiene ningún otro efecto.

trans-unit.source: The port is a decimal port number. 0 means a default or anonymous port, depending on the protocol.
trans-unit.target: El port es un número de puerto decimal. 0 significa un puerto predeterminado o anónimo, según el protocolo.

trans-unit.source: The port part of the returned string is the value returned by getPort() in its shortest decimal form. If the value is zero, it is omitted.
The port part of the returned string is the value returned by getPort() in its shortest decimal form. If the value is zero, it is omitted.
trans-unit.target: La parte del port de la cadena devuelta es el valor devuelto por getPort() en su forma decimal más corta. Si el valor es cero, se omite.

trans-unit.source: The protocol-version is a series of two or more non-negative integers separated by periods (.). An implementation of the version described by this documentation must use the string 1.0 here.
trans-unit.target: La protocol-version es una serie de dos o más enteros no negativos separados por puntos ( . ). Una implementación de la versión descrita por esta documentación debe usar la cadena 1.0 aquí.

trans-unit.source: The url-path, if any, begins with a slash (/) or a semicolon (;) and continues to the end of the address. It can contain attributes using the semicolon syntax specified in RFC 2609. Those attributes are not parsed by this class and incorrect attribute syntax is not detected.
trans-unit.target: La url-path , si la hay, comienza con una barra ( / ) o un punto y coma ( ; ) y continúa hasta el final de la dirección. Puede contener atributos utilizando la sintaxis de punto y coma especificada en RFC 2609. Esos atributos no son analizados por esta clase y no se detecta una sintaxis de atributo incorrecta.

trans-unit.source: The ? character matches exactly one character of a name component.
trans-unit.target: El ? carácter coincide exactamente con un carácter de un componente de nombre.

trans-unit.source: The @Deprecated annotation should always be present if the @deprecated javadoc tag is present, and vice-versa.
The AWTEventMonitor implements a suite of listeners that are conditionally installed on every AWT component instance in the Java Virtual Machine.

The AWTEventMonitor implements a suite of listeners that are conditionally installed on every AWT component instance in the Java Virtual Machine. The events captured by these listeners are made available through a unified set of listeners supported by AWTEventMonitor. With this, all the individual events on each of the AWT component instances are funneled into one set of listeners broken down by category (see EventID for the categories).
The AccessControlContext may contain many Subjects (from nested doAs calls). In this situation, the most recent Subject associated with the AccessControlContext is returned.
trans-unit.target: El AccessControlContext puede contener muchos sujetos (de llamadas doAs anidadas ). En esta situación, se devuelve el Subject más reciente asociado con AccessControlContext .

trans-unit.source: The AccessibilityListenerList is a copy of the Swing EventListerList class.
The AccessibleAction interface should be supported by any object that can perform one or more actions.

The AccessibleAction interface should be supported by any object that can perform one or more actions. This interface provides the standard mechanism for an assistive technology to determine what those actions are as well as tell the object to perform them. Any object that can be manipulated should support this interface. Applications can determine if an object supports the AccessibleAction interface by first obtaining its AccessibleContext (see Accessible) and then calling the AccessibleContext.getAccessibleAction() method. If the return value is not null, the object supports this interface.
The AccessibleComponent interface should be supported by any object that is rendered on the screen.

The AccessibleComponent interface should be supported by any object that is rendered on the screen. This interface provides the standard mechanism for an assistive technology to determine and set the graphical representation of an object. Applications can determine if an object supports the AccessibleComponent interface by first obtaining its AccessibleContext and then calling the AccessibleContext.getAccessibleComponent() method. If the return value is not null, the object supports this interface.
The AccessibleContext associated with this Component.
The AccessibleContext for the ProgressMonitor
The AccessibleEditableText interface should be implemented by all classes that present editable textual information on the display.

The AccessibleEditableText interface should be implemented by all classes that present editable textual information on the display. Along with the AccessibleText interface, this interface provides the standard mechanism for an assistive technology to access that text via its content, attributes, and spatial location. Applications can determine if an object supports the AccessibleEditableText interface by first obtaining its AccessibleContext (see Accessible) and then calling the AccessibleContext.getAccessibleEditableText() method of AccessibleContext. If the return value is not null, the object supports this interface.
The AccessibleExtendedComponent interface should be supported by any object that is rendered on the screen.

The AccessibleExtendedComponent interface should be supported by any object that is rendered on the screen. This interface provides the standard mechanism for an assistive technology to determine the extended graphical representation of an object. Applications can determine if an object supports the AccessibleExtendedComponent interface by first obtaining its AccessibleContext and then calling the AccessibleContext.getAccessibleComponent() method. If the return value is not null and the type of the return value is AccessibleExtendedComponent, the object supports this interface.
The AccessibleExtendedText interface contains additional methods not provided by the AccessibleText interface.
The AccessibleHypertext class is the base class for all classes that present hypertext information on the display.

The AccessibleHypertext class is the base class for all classes that present hypertext information on the display. This class provides the standard mechanism for an assistive technology to access that text via its content, attributes, and spatial location. It also provides standard mechanisms for manipulating hyperlinks. Applications can determine if an object supports the AccessibleHypertext interface by first obtaining its AccessibleContext (see Accessible) and then calling the AccessibleContext.getAccessibleText() method of AccessibleContext. If the return value is a class which extends AccessibleHypertext, then that object supports AccessibleHypertext.
The AccessibleIcon interface should be supported by any object that has an associated icon (e.g., buttons).

The AccessibleIcon interface should be supported by any object that has an associated icon (e.g., buttons). This interface provides the standard mechanism for an assistive technology to get descriptive information about icons. Applications can determine if an object supports the AccessibleIcon interface by first obtaining its AccessibleContext (see Accessible) and then calling the AccessibleContext.getAccessibleIcon() method. If the return value is not null, the object supports this interface.
The AccessibleKeyBinding interface should be supported by any object that has a keyboard bindings such as a keyboard mnemonic and/or keyboard shortcut which can be used to select the object.

The AccessibleKeyBinding interface should be supported by any object that has a keyboard bindings such as a keyboard mnemonic and/or keyboard shortcut which can be used to select the object. This interface provides the standard mechanism for an assistive technology to determine the key bindings which exist for this object. Any object that has such key bindings should support this interface.
The AccessibleObject class is the base class for Field, Method, and Constructor objects (known as reflected objects).

The AccessibleObject class is the base class for Field, Method, and Constructor objects (known as reflected objects). It provides the ability to flag a reflected object as suppressing checks for Java language access control when it is used. This permits sophisticated applications with sufficient privilege, such as Java Object Serialization or other persistence mechanisms, to manipulate objects in a manner that would normally be prohibited.
The AccessibleStreamable interface should be implemented by the AccessibleContext of any component that presents the raw stream behind a component on the display screen.

The AccessibleStreamable interface should be implemented by the AccessibleContext of any component that presents the raw stream behind a component on the display screen. Examples of such components are HTML, bitmap images and MathML. An object that implements AccessibleStreamable provides two things: a list of MIME types supported by the object and a streaming interface for each MIME type to get the data.
The AccessibleTableModelChange interface describes a change to the table model.
The AccessibleTableModelChange interface describes a change to the table model. The attributes of the model change can be obtained by the following methods:
The AccessibleText interface should be implemented by all classes that present textual information on the display.

The AccessibleText interface should be implemented by all classes that present textual information on the display. This interface provides the standard mechanism for an assistive technology to access that text via its content, attributes, and spatial location. Applications can determine if an object supports the AccessibleText interface by first obtaining its AccessibleContext (see Accessible) and then calling the AccessibleContext.getAccessibleText() method of AccessibleContext. If the return value is not null, the object supports this interface.
The AccessibleValue interface should be supported by any object that supports a numerical value (e.g., a scroll bar).

The AccessibleValue interface should be supported by any object that supports a numerical value (e.g., a scroll bar). This interface provides the standard mechanism for an assistive technology to determine and set the numerical value as well as get the minimum and maximum values. Applications can determine if an object supports the AccessibleValue interface by first obtaining its AccessibleContext (see Accessible) and then calling the AccessibleContext.getAccessibleValue() method. If the return value is not null, the object supports this interface.
The Action interface provides a useful extension to the ActionListener interface in cases where the same functionality may be accessed by several controls.
The Action is added as an ActionListener to the component.
The ActionListener will receive an ActionEvent when a selection has been made. If the combo box is editable, then an ActionEvent will be fired when editing has stopped.
The Activatable class provides support for remote objects that require persistent access over time and that can be activated by the system.

The ActivationGroupID is returned from the call to ActivationSystem.registerGroup and is used to identify the group within the activation system. This group id is passed as one of the arguments to the activation group's special constructor when an activation group is created/recreated.
The ActivationSystem provides a means for registering groups and "activatable" objects to be activated within those groups.

The ActivationSystem provides a means for registering groups and "activatable" objects to be activated within those groups. The ActivationSystem works closely with the Activator, which activates objects registered via the ActivationSystem, and the ActivationMonitor, which obtains information about active and inactive objects, and inactive groups.
The Activator facilitates remote object activation.

The Activator facilitates remote object activation. A "faulting" remote reference calls the activator's activate method to obtain a "live" reference to a "activatable" remote object. Upon receiving a request for activation, the activator looks up the activation descriptor for the activation identifier, id, determines the group in which the object should be activated initiates object re-creation via the group's ActivationInstantiator (via a call to the newInstance method). The activator initiates the execution of activation groups as necessary. For example, if an activation group for a specific group identifier is not already executing, the activator initiates the execution of a VM for the group.

The Activator works closely with ActivationSystem, which provides a means for registering groups and objects within those groups, and ActivationMonitor, which receives information about active and inactive objects and inactive groups.
The AdjustmentEvent class defines five types of adjustment event, listed here:
The AffineTransform associated with this op.
The AffineTransform class represents a 2D affine transform that performs a linear mapping from 2D coordinates to other 2D coordinates that preserves the "straightness" and "parallelness" of lines.

The AffineTransform class represents a 2D affine transform that performs a linear mapping from 2D coordinates to other 2D coordinates that preserves the "straightness" and "parallelness" of lines. Affine transformations can be constructed using sequences of translations, scales, flips, rotations, and shears.
The AlgorithmParameterGenerator class is used to generate a set of parameters to be used with a certain algorithm.
trans-unit.target: La clase AlgorithmParameterGenerator se utiliza para generar un conjunto de parámetros que se utilizarán con un determinado algoritmo.

trans-unit.source: The AlgorithmParameterGenerator class is used to generate a set of parameters to be used with a certain algorithm. Parameter generators are constructed using the getInstance factory methods (static methods that return instances of a given class).
trans-unit.target: La clase AlgorithmParameterGenerator se utiliza para generar un conjunto de parámetros que se utilizarán con un determinado algoritmo. Los generadores de parámetros se construyen utilizando los métodos de fábrica getInstance (métodos estáticos que devuelven instancias de una clase determinada).

trans-unit.source: The AlphaComposite class defines an additional alpha value that is applied to the source alpha. This value is applied as if an implicit SRC_IN rule were first applied to the source pixel against a pixel with the indicated alpha by multiplying both the raw source alpha and the raw source colors by the alpha in the AlphaComposite. This leads to the following equation for producing the alpha used in the Porter and Duff blending equation:
The AlphaComposite class implements basic alpha compositing rules for combining source and destination colors to achieve blending and transparency effects with graphics and images.

The AlphaComposite class implements basic alpha compositing rules for combining source and destination colors to achieve blending and transparency effects with graphics and images. The specific rules implemented by this class are the basic set of 12 rules described in T. Porter and T. Duff, "Compositing Digital Images", SIGGRAPH 84, 253-259. The rest of this documentation assumes some familiarity with the definitions and concepts outlined in that paper.

The Applet class must be the superclass of any applet that is to be embedded in a Web page or viewed by the Java Applet Viewer. The Applet class provides a standard interface between applets and their environment.
The Area class creates an area geometry from the specified Shape object.

The Area class creates an area geometry from the specified Shape object. The geometry is explicitly closed, if the Shape is not already closed. The fill rule (even-odd or winding) specified by the geometry of the Shape is used to determine the resulting enclosed area.

The Area class implements the Shape interface and provides full support for all of its hit-testing and path iteration facilities, but an Area is more specific than a generalized path in a number of ways:
The Array class provides static methods to dynamically create and access Java arrays.
trans-unit.target: La clase Array proporciona métodos estáticos para crear y acceder dinámicamente a matrices Java.

The Attr interface represents an attribute in an Element object.
The Attr interface represents an attribute in an Element object. Typically the allowable values for the attribute are defined in a schema associated with the document.

trans-unit.source: The AudioClip interface is a simple abstraction for playing a sound clip. Multiple AudioClip items can be playing at the same time, and the resulting sound is mixed together to produce a composite.

The AudioFormat class accommodates a number of common sound-file encoding techniques, including pulse-code modulation (PCM), mu-law encoding, and a-law encoding. These encoding techniques are predefined, but service providers can create new encoding types. The encoding that a specific format uses is named by its encoding field.
trans-unit.target: La clase AudioFormat se adapta a una serie de técnicas de codificación de archivos de sonido comunes, incluida la modulación de código de pulso (PCM), codificación mu-law y codificación a-law. Estas técnicas de codificación están predefinidas, pero los proveedores de servicios pueden crear nuevos tipos de codificación. La codificación que utiliza un formato específico se nombra por su campo de encoding .

trans-unit.source: The AudioPermission class represents access rights to the audio system resources.
trans-unit.target: La clase AudioPermission representa los derechos de acceso a los recursos del sistema de audio.

trans-unit.source: The AudioPermission class represents access rights to the audio system resources. An AudioPermission contains a target name but no actions list; you either have the named permission or you don't.
trans-unit.target: La clase AudioPermission representa los derechos de acceso a los recursos del sistema de audio. Un AudioPermission contiene un nombre de destino pero no una lista de acciones; o tiene el permiso indicado o no lo tiene.

trans-unit.source: The AudioSystem class acts as the entry point to the sampled-audio system resources.
trans-unit.target: La clase AudioSystem actúa como el punto de entrada a los recursos del sistema de audio muestreado.

trans-unit.source: The AudioSystem class acts as the entry point to the sampled-audio system resources. This class lets you query and access the mixers that are installed on the system. AudioSystem includes a number of methods for converting audio data between different formats, and for translating between audio files and streams. It also provides a method for obtaining a Line directly from the AudioSystem without dealing explicitly with mixers.

The AudioSystem class acts as the entry point to the sampled-audio system resources. This class lets you query and access the mixers that are installed on the system. AudioSystem includes a number of methods for converting audio data between different formats, and for translating between audio files and streams. It also provides a method for obtaining a Line directly from the AudioSystem without dealing explicitly with mixers.
trans-unit.target: La clase AudioSystem actúa como el punto de entrada a los recursos del sistema de audio muestreado. Esta clase le permite consultar y acceder a los mezcladores que están instalados en el sistema. AudioSystem incluye varios métodos para convertir datos de audio entre diferentes formatos y para traducir entre archivos de audio y transmisiones. También proporciona un método para obtener una Line directamente del AudioSystem sin tratar explícitamente con mezcladores.
